134.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
134.title: An Act Concerning Reforms To The Bonding Authorization Process.
134.description: To reduce the level of bonding, provide targeted funding for economic growth and create a new system with criteria for authorizing and allocating bonding projects that will stimulate job growth and economic development.

135.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections
135.title: An Act Concerning The Elimination Of Grants From The Citizens' Election Program To Unopposed Candidates And The Transfer Of The Resulting Savings To The General Fund.
135.description: To eliminate grants to unopposed candidates under the Citizens' Election Program and to transfer any resulting savings to the General Fund.

136.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary
136.title: An Act Concerning Home Improvement Subcontractor Liens.
136.description: To bar a home improvement subcontractor from placing a mechanic's lien on a residential homeowner's property for failure of the contractor to pay the subcontractor when the homeowner has paid the contractor or is disputing the contractor's compliance with a home improvement contract.

137.title: An Act Making Minor And Technical Revisions To Department Of Consumer Protection Statutes.
137.description: To make minor and technical changes to Department of Consumer Protection statutes.

138.title: An Act Concerning The Sale Of Wine With Gift Baskets.
138.description: To establish a gift basket retailer permit to allow for the retail sale of wine with gift baskets, subject to certain restrictions.

139.title: An Act Amending The Liquor Control Act.
139.description: To repeal the racquetball facility liquor permit, to allow institutions of higher education to manufacture or dispense wine at wine tasting and wine education classes, subject to applicable liquor control laws, to allow cafe liquor permit holders to open for business at 6 a.m. to serve breakfast, but not alcohol, to their customers and to permit tavern and cafe premises to remain open past normal hours for the purpose of motion picture filming, but not for the service of alcohol.

140.title: An Act Concerning The Handling Of Property Claims By Public Adjusters.
140.description: To require that only public adjusters prepare or submit a property claim or negotiate such claim on behalf of the insured and to specify additional disclosure requirements in the written notice provided by a person performing repair or remediation work under a personal or commercial risk policy.

141.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
141.title: An Act Concerning Consolidation Of Services Provided By Private Organizations.
141.description: To attain greater efficiencies and cost containment in the delivery of services by private nonprofit providers.

142.title: An Act Concerning Investigations By The Department Of Children And Families.
142.description: To require the Department of Children and Families to provide a notice of rights upon commencing an investigation.

143.title: An Act Concerning The Operation Of Riverview Hospital And Connecticut Children's Place.
143.description: To require the Commissioners of Children and Families and Mental Health and Addiction Services to consider and report on transferring operations of Riverview Hospital and Connecticut Children's Place to the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services.

144.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
144.title: An Act Concerning An Increase In The Amount Of Federal Funds Received By State Agencies.
144.description: To increase the amount of federal funding that the Departments of Social Services, Children and Families, Mental Health and Addiction Services, and Developmental Services receive.

145.title: An Act Concerning Visitation Of Children Committed To The Department Of Children And Families.
145.description: To specify the procedures when the Department of Children and Families cancels a visit with a child committed to the department.

146.title: An Act Concerning Surety Bail Bond Agents And Professional Bondsmen.
146.description: To improve the regulation of surety bail bond agents and professional bondsmen in this state.

147.title: An Act Concerning Funding For The Judicial Branch.
147.description: To exempt the Judicial Branch from a requirement to reduce its other expenses account to the fiscal year 2007 level, and revise the process with respect to recommended appropriations for, and the reduction of allotment requisitions by, the Judicial Branch.

148.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
148.title: An Act Concerning The Urban Homesteading Statute.
148.description: To expand the definition of an urban homesteading agency.

149.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
149.title: An Act Increasing Payments In Lieu Of Taxes To Municipalities.
149.description: To increase amounts paid to municipalities for payments in lieu of taxes for state-owned properties, colleges and hospitals.

150.title: An Act Concerning Grants In Lieu Of Taxes On Land Taken Into Trust For The Mashantucket Pequot Tribal Nation And The Mohegan Tribe.
150.description: To compensate towns more fairly for land declared exempt from local property taxes because it has been taken into trust for the Mashantucket Pequot Tribal Nation and the Mohegan Tribe.

151.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
151.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Any Growth In State Revenue Streams.
151.description: To provide a long-term funding stream for municipal programs such as education cost sharing, town aid road and local capital improvement program.

152.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
152.title: An Act Concerning The Powers Of Certain United States Secret Service Agents And Officers.
152.description: To redefine "peace officer" to include any United States Secret Service officer, employee or agent in the performance of his or her duties.

153.title: An Act Including Hospital Security Officers In The Assault Of Public Safety, Emergency Medical Or Public Transit Personnel Offense.
153.description: To make the assault of a security officer assigned to a hospital a class C felony.

154.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
154.title: An Act Concerning The Timing Of Testing For Blood Alcohol Levels In Operating Under The Influence Cases.
154.description: To remove the requirement that a test for blood alcohol levels be performed within two hours of operation for purposes of administrative per se hearings and to require that any test not commenced within two hours be established as reliable by expert witness testimony for purpose of criminal prosecution.

155.title: An Act Concerning The Dismissal Of Local Fire Marshals.
155.description: To clarify that a municipality may dismiss a fire marshal employed or appointed on an at will basis in accordance with such municipality's charter or home rule ordinance.

156.title: An Act Concerning The Advertisement Of Bazaars And Raffles.
156.description: To permit nonprofit organizations to advertise their bazaar or raffle by posting an advertisement on the organization's Internet web site, sending an advertisement via electronic mail or posting one or more lawn signs.

157.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
157.title: An Act Concerning The Regulation Of Firearms.
157.description: To require gun show promoters to notify the Commissioner of Public Safety of any planned gun show; to mandate annual firearms safety refresher courses for bail enforcement agents, professional bondsmen and surety bail bond agents; to require that certain firearms and criminal justice course instructors be approved by the Commissioner of Public Safety; to provide an exemption to the offenses of selling, carrying or brandishing a facsimile firearm for a participant in a state certified qualified production; to change the blood alcohol limit for the offense of carrying a firearm while intoxicated to achieve parity with the level for the offense of operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated; to add a date and place of birth requirement for certain forms regarding firearms permits and purchases, to require notification of a firearm purchase to the Department of Public Safety no later than twenty-four hours after purchase; to prohibit an alien without legal permanent resident status from purchasing a firearm; and add to the offenses of criminal possession of a firearm anyone prohibited by any court order from possessing a firearm.

158.title: An Act Concerning An Assessment For Regulatory Oversight Of The Connecticut Lottery Corporation.
158.description: To give the Office of Policy and Management the ability to assess the total cost incurred by the Division of Special Revenue for its regulatory oversight of the Connecticut Lottery Corporation and to require the corporation to pay such assessment in quarterly payments.

159.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Human Services
159.title: An Act Concerning The Well-being Of All Connecticut Children And Requiring An Annual Report Card Evaluating State Policies And Programs Impacting Children.
159.description: To implement a recommendation of the Legislative Program and Investigations Committee concerning the application of results-based accountability principles to selected human services programs.

160.title: An Act Requiring The Training Of The Staff Of The Department Of Children And Families On Grandparent Visitation Rights.
160.description: To require the Commissioner of the Department of Children and Families to develop a training program for employees concerning grandparents' visitation rights.

161.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans Affairs
161.title: An Act Establishing A Memorial For Connecticut Veterans Of World War Ii Buried In France.
161.description: To create a memorial to the Connecticut veterans of World War II buried in Monet, France.

162.title: An Act Requiring The Establishment Of A Searchable Database For State Expenditures.
162.description: To increase transparency in state spending.

163.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendation Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Alignment Of Postsecondary Education And Employment In The Green Industry.
163.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning the alignment of postsecondary education and employment in the green industry.

164.title: An Act Concerning High School Graduation Requirements.
164.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations committee concerning alignment of post-secondary education and employment.

165.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Aging
165.title: An Act Increasing The Tax Relief Provided By The Circuit Breaker Program.
165.description: To provide property tax relief for elderly homeowners in the circuit breaker program.

166.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
166.title: An Act Concerning The Recent Increase In State Fees.
166.description: To reassess the manner in which state fees have been increased.

167.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
167.title: An Act Concerning A Tax Credit For Businesses That Hire Former Inmates.
167.description: To create a tax credit for businesses that hire former inmates.

168.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
168.title: An Act Requiring A Cost-benefit Analysis Of State Tax Expenditures.
168.description: To conduct a cost-benefit analysis of all state tax expenditures.

169.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
169.title: An Act Concerning A Mansion Tax.
169.description: To establish a mansion property tax to reduce the state's indebtedness.

170.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
170.title: An Act Requiring A Tax Incidence Analysis.
170.description: To evaluate the performance of the local and state tax infrastructures.

171.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
171.title: An Act Exempting Municipal Insurance Contracts And Policies From The Insurance Premium Tax.
171.description: To provide relief to towns and cities by reducing health insurance costs.

172.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
172.title: An Act Concerning An Annual Review Of The State's General Obligation Debt.
172.description: To reduce the state's indebtedness and its debt service obligations in the budget.

173.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
173.title: An Act Concerning The Property Tax Credit Against The Personal Income Tax.

174.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
174.title: An Act Imposing A Tax On Bonuses Received By Employees Of Businesses That Received Funds Under The Troubled Asset Relief Program.
174.description: To require those who created the economic meltdown to contribute to the recovery.

175.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
175.title: An Act Concerning Enactment Of A Property Tax Fairness Act.
175.description: To pass a state-wide municipal tax to enable comprehensive property tax reform for families and individuals.

176.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
176.title: An Act Concerning The Elimination Of Tax Expenditures.
176.description: To increase revenue collection and implement lower tax rates to foster job creation.

177.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
177.title: An Act Establishing A State-earned Income Tax Credit.
177.description: To establish a state-earned income tax credit equal to twenty per cent of the federal-earned income tax credit.

178.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
178.title: An Act Concerning Unitary Reporting For Corporate Taxes.
178.description: To enact unitary reporting for corporate taxes.

179.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
179.title: An Act Eliminating Exemptions From The Sales And Use Taxes.
179.description: To enhance revenue derived from sales tax collection.

180.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
180.title: An Act Concerning A Refundable Property Tax Credit.
180.description: To make the property tax credit refundable, so that it benefits taxpayers whose incomes are too low to take all of the credit they are owed.

181.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary
181.title: An Act Increasing The Fine For Using A Cellular Telephone While Operating A Motor Vehicle.
181.description: To increase the fine for operating a motor vehicle while using a hand-held mobile telephone or a mobile electronic device and to require that a portion of that fine be remitted to the town where the violation occurred.

182.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary
182.title: An Act Concerning The Age Of Juvenile Jurisdiction.
182.description: To delay implementation of the increase in the age of juvenile jurisdiction.

183.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
183.title: An Act Concerning Pilot Payments.
183.description: To prevent municipalities from experiencing large budget shortfalls.

184.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Aging
184.title: An Act Providing Financial Assistance And Tax Relief To Grandparent Caregivers.
184.description: To increase financial assistance to grandparents raising their grandchildren.

185.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Provisions Of The Securities And Business Investments Law Of Connecticut Governing Notice, The Denial, Suspension Or Revocation Of Registration, And The Disclosure To Purchaser-investors.
185.description: To make technical revisions to various statutes in the Securities and Business Investments Law of Connecticut.

186.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
186.title: An Act Establishing Tax Credits For Job Creation.
186.description: To provide tax credits to new manufacturing businesses or to businesses that through expansion increase their workforces by twenty or more employees.

187.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
187.title: An Act Concerning The Creation Of Jobs And Helping Connecticut Companies Grow And Stay In Connecticut.
187.description: To create jobs in Connecticut for companies to be more competitive and insure their long-term commitment to stay and grow in Connecticut.

188.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
188.title: An Act Concerning A Monthly Report From The State Treasurer Regarding The State's Cash Balance.
188.description: To ensure timely reporting of the state's cash balance from the State Treasurer.

189.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
189.title: An Act Concerning The Deductibility Of Noncash Compensation For Purposes Of The Corporation Business Tax.
189.description: To provide a cap on the amount of noncash compensation companies may deduct from their net income, for purposes of the corporation business tax.

190.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
190.title: An Act Concerning A Progressive Corporate Income Tax.
190.description: To make the corporate income tax progressive, with a 5% rate for net incomes of less than $200,000, a 10% rate for net incomes over $1 million and the current 7.5% for incomes from $200,000 to $1 million.

191.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
191.title: An Act Concerning Reimbursement For Updating Hvac Systems In Schools.
191.description: To encourage and assist municipalities to update school facilities with energy efficient HVAC systems.

192.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections
192.title: An Act Concerning The Purchase Of Trust-preferred Securities By The State Treasurer.
192.description: To allow the State Treasurer to invest in Connecticut banks and provide such banks with increased capital.

193.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement
193.title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of A Business Component To The Youth Services Bureaus.
193.description: To increase employment and educational options for youth.

194.title: An Act Concerning The Rehiring Of Retired State Employees.
194.description: To limit the duration and number of times a retired state employee may be rehired by the state in order to ensure jobs are available to new prospective employees.

195.title: An Act Concerning Credit Protection For Youth In Foster Care.
195.description: To protect children and youth from having their Social Security numbers misused when in foster care.

196.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Postponement Of Program Termination Dates In The Sunset Law.
196.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning postponement of the program termination dates in the sunset law.

197.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
197.title: An Act Concerning The Design, Installation And Cost Of Highway Sound Barriers.
197.description: To protect residents from the impact of increased highway traffic in the immediate vicinity of their homes.

198.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
198.title: An Act Requiring The Establishment Of Tolls.
198.description: To establish tolls to raise revenue.

199.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
199.title: An Act Concerning Information From Entities Participating In Tax Credit Programs.
199.description: To provide information on the performance and efficacy of tax credits.

200.title: An Act Concerning Interest Penalties On Late Payment Of Assessments To The Second Injury Fund.
200.description: To amend the penalty for late payments and surcharges to the Second Injury Fund to reflect legislative intent.

201.title: An Act Concerning Telecommuting Options For State Employees.
201.description: To encourage the use of telecommuting by state employees.

202.title: An Act Concerning Teachers' Retirement Credit And Hazardous Duty Retirement Credit For Certain Employees At The Department Of Environmental Protection.
202.description: To allow certain individuals who retired based upon a material error in their retirement benefit statements to be compensated for said error or return to their previous employment position.

203.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Joint Enforcement Commission On Employee Misclassification.
203.description: To implement the recommendations of the joint enforcement commission on employee misclassification.

204.title: An Act Concerning Construction Safety Refresher Training Courses.
204.description: To require certain persons on public works projects who have completed their initial OSHA training course to take a four-hour refresher course every three years rather than a ten-hour course every five years.

205.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
205.title: An Act Providing An Individual An Earlier Release From The Jurisdiction Of The Commission On Human Rights And Opportunities To File A Civil Action In Superior Court.
205.description: To allow a person claiming to be aggrieved by an alleged discriminatory practice to file a complaint with the superior court rather than with the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities.

206.title: An Act Concerning Criminal Background Checks For Prospective State Employees.
206.description: To require state employers to make conditional offers of employment to individuals prior to inquiring about their past criminal convictions.

207.title: An Act Concerning The Permit And Regulatory Authority Of The Department Of Environmental Protection And Establishing An Office Of The Permit Ombudsman Within The Department Of Economic And Community Development.
207.description: To improve the partnership of state and local governments in economic development and help ensure that economic development projects are approved as quickly as possible.

208.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
208.title: An Act Concerning Small Business Tax Credits.
208.description: To provide a tax credit for small businesses that create jobs.

209.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Energy and Technology
209.title: An Act Concerning The Membership Of The Connecticut Energy Advisory Board.
209.description: To add the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to the membership of the Connecticut Energy Advisory Board.

210.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
210.title: An Act Establishing An Income Tax Credit For Investments In Connecticut Start-up Businesses.
210.description: To establish tax credits for angel investors who invest in qualified Connecticut start-up businesses.

211.title: An Act Concerning Insurance Coverage For The Treatment Of Bleeding Diseases.
211.description: To improve access to appropriate medical care for persons with bleeding disorders.

212.title: An Act Concerning The Siting Council.
212.description: To authorize the Connecticut Siting Council to impose civil fines and award attorney fees and costs to opposing parties when it determines that the petitioner has misrepresented or omitted material facts.

213.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Wind Power.
213.description: To require the Commissioner of Correction to establish a pilot program for the use of wind turbines at an appropriate correctional facility in order to produce energy for the benefit of the correctional facility and the municipality where the correctional facility is located.

214.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
214.title: An Act Concerning Modifications To The Purchased Gas, Energy And Transmission Rate Adjustment Clauses.
214.description: To make modifications to the provisions of the Department of Public Utility Control's purchased gas and energy adjustment clauses by requiring the department to hold a public hearing no less than annually in lieu of the current six-month requirement and specifying that the department hold a public hearing at any time for the purchased gas, energy and transmission rate adjustment clauses if the Office of Consumer Counsel files an application requesting such a hearing.

215.title: An Act Concerning Utility Termination For Households With A Member Less Than Twenty-four Months Old.
215.description: To extend the prohibition on utility termination to households that include children less than twenty-four months old.

216.title: An Act Concerning Energy Efficient Products.
216.description: To add products to be subjected to certain efficiency standards and to provide for the Office of Policy and Management to identify additional product and equipment efficiency standards.

217.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
217.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From The Personal Income Tax For Pensions And Social Security.
217.description: To phase out the personal income tax on pensions and Social Security.

218.title: An Act Extending State Continuation Of Health Insurance Coverage.
218.description: To extend the period for continuation of group health insurance coverage following certain qualifying events to thirty months.

219.title: An Act Concerning Competition In The Motor Fuel Industry.
219.description: To promote competition in the motor fuel industry in order to lower retail motor fuel prices.

220.title: An Act Concerning The Registration Of Appraisal Management Companies.
220.description: To require the registration and regulation of real estate appraisal management companies in this state.

221.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary
221.title: An Act Concerning Residential Retail Heating Oil And Propane Contracts.
221.description: To protect residential heating oil and propane consumers.

222.title: An Act Concerning Organized Retail Theft.
222.description: To reduce the incidence of organized retail theft.

223.title: An Act Concerning Implied Warranties Of Merchantability And The Return Of Consumer Goods.

224.title: An Act Concerning Solar Work.
224.description: To ensure solar electricity work is performed safely, to authorize E-1 and E-2 license holders to perform solar voltaic work, subject to certain conditions, and to eliminate a licensing exemption relating to the hoisting, placement and anchoring of solar collectors, photovoltaic panels, towers and turbines.

225.title: An Act Concerning Qualified Alcohol Servers.
225.description: To protect the public by requiring bartenders to complete alcohol server training programs.

226.title: An Act Prohibiting Penalty Fees In Certain Consumer Contracts.
226.description: To prohibit retailers from charging consumers restocking, handling or processing fees for returned goods.

227.title: An Act Concerning The Sales Of Event Tickets On The Secondary Market.
227.description: To protect consumers who purchase tickets to sporting and entertainment events.

228.title: An Act Requiring Law Enforcement Reporting Of The Service Of Alcohol To Minors.
228.description: To require law enforcement officials to report investigations regarding minors who have been served alcohol by liquor permittees to the Department of Consumer Protection.

229.title: An Act Concerning The Licensing Of Swimming Pool Installers.
229.description: To require the licensure of swimming pool installers.

230.title: An Act Concerning The Sale Of Wine At Farmers' Markets.
230.description: To allow farm wineries to sell wine at farmers' markets.

231.title: An Act Concerning Transfer Or Discharge Of Residential Care Home Patients.
231.description: To allow nonattorney advocates to represent residential care home residents at hearings to appeal a transfer or discharge, to specify the time for filing documents related to a transfer or discharge, and to extend the time period to appeal a transfer or discharge.

232.title: An Act Concerning Insurance Coverage And Certain Liquor Licenses.
232.description: To require liquor liability insurance and general liability insurance for certain classes of permits issued by the Department of Consumer Protection.

233.title: An Act Preventing A Labor Organization From Waiving An Employee's Right To Bring A Civil Action For A Civil Rights Violation Against An Employer.
233.description: To prevent labor organizations from bargaining away the rights of an employee to bring a civil action for an employer's violation of said employee's civil rights.

234.title: An Act Requiring The Providing Of Certain Information Upon Certain Denials Of Health Insurance Coverage.
234.description: To require insurers and other entities, in the event of a denial based on the reason that the requested service is not a covered benefit, to mail to an insured a copy of the applicable provision of the policy or certificate governing such decision, and to include in such mailing a notice with the contact information of the Insurance Department and the Office of the Healthcare Advocate.

235.title: An Act Concerning Additional Off-track Betting Branch Facilities In New London, Manchester And Windham.
235.description: To permit the simulcasting of off-track betting race programs in an additional facility in New London.

236.title: An Act Concerning The Investigation Of Missing Persons Reports.
236.description: To improve the ability of law enforcement agencies to locate and return missing persons, identify human remains, and provide timely information and notification to the family members of missing persons.

237.title: An Act Requiring Verification Of Automobile Insurance Coverage Of Persons Engaged In The Delivery Of Newspapers.
237.description: To require persons that hire or contract with individuals for the delivery of newspapers to verify that such individuals have valid registration and current automobile insurance.

238.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Veterans Affairs
238.title: An Act Exempting Veterans' Pensions From The State Income Tax.
238.description: To exempt veterans' pensions from the state income tax.

239.title: An Act Concerning Affordable Housing Developments In Environmentally Regulated Areas.
239.description: To discontinue the practice of having affordable housing development take precedence over the protection of the environment and natural resources.

240.title: An Act Concerning Candlewood Lake.
240.description: To authorize the adoption of regulations that establish a maximum boat length on Candlewood Lake.

242.title: An Act Concerning Sober Houses.
242.description: To require sober houses to designate a manager to supervise the facility.

243.title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Emergency Certificates By Certain Staff Of The Emergency Mobile Psychiatric Services Program.
243.description: To permit designated professionals operating within the Department of Children and Families' Emergency Mobile Psychiatric Services (EMPS) program the authority to issue emergency certificates directing that a child with psychiatric disabilities be hospitalized for an evaluation.

244.title: An Act Concerning A Report On The Privatization Of Group Homes.
244.description: To establish a task force to study the privatization of group homes.

245.title: An Act Concerning The Protection Of, And Services For, Victims Of Domestic Violence.
245.description: To require distribution of the marriage license surcharge and to provide assistance in the area of housing to victims of domestic violence.

246.title: An Act Concerning Competency To Stand Trial.
246.description: To (1) add additional criminal offenses to those for which periodic competency examinations of defendants may be ordered, and to provide that ordered examinations occur at intervals of not less than six months, and (2) allow a court to receive notice if a defendant is released from the custody of the Commissioner of Mental Health and Addiction Services prior to the expiration of the statute of limitations for the crime with which the defendant was charged.

247.title: An Act Establishing A Sentencing Commission.
247.description: To establish a permanent sentencing commission to review on an ongoing basis criminal justice and sentencing policies and laws of this state.

248.title: An Act Concerning The Confidentiality Of Certain Documents And Records In Psychiatric Security Review Board Proceedings.
248.description: To clarify the confidentiality of psychiatric and psychological reports in the possession of the Psychiatric Security Review Board.

249.title: An Act Concerning The Board Of Pardons And Paroles.
249.description: To allow more pardons hearings to be conducted by the Board of Pardons and Paroles by increasing the number of part-time members who serve exclusively on pardons panels.

250.title: An Act Concerning Payment Of The Costs Of Forensic Sexual Assault Evidence Examinations And The Collection Of Dna Samples.
250.description: To transfer the responsibility for payment of the costs incurred by health care facilities for forensic sexual assault evidence examinations from the Division of Criminal Justice to the Office of Victim Services within the Judicial Department.

251.title: An Act Concerning The Pretrial Alcohol Education Program And The Pretrial Drug Education Program.
251.description: To make minor, technical and conforming changes to the pretrial alcohol education program and the pretrial drug education program.

252.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To Various Statutes Concerning The Criminal Justice System.
252.description: To revise the elements of the crime of failure to appear, to provide for judicial discretion in the sentencing of teenagers in certain sexual assault cases, to revise the penalty for failing to appear for jury duty and the agency responsible for enforcing such violation, to facilitate the investigation and prosecution of forgery and to make youthful offender records available to law enforcement and prosecutorial officials conducting criminal investigations.

253.last_action: Potential Disagreeing Action, Tabled for the Calendar, House
253.title: An Act Concerning The Jeopardy Collection Of Taxes.
253.description: To repeal section 12-163 of the general statutes concerning the jeopardy collection of taxes.

254.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Mandate Relief.

255.title: An Act Concerning Local Appeals Of Decisions Of Local Traffic Authorities.
255.description: To clarify the local appeals process for orders and regulations of traffic authorities.

256.title: An Act Concerning The Termination Of New Municipal Mandates.
256.description: To require automatic three-year expiration dates for new municipal mandates.

257.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Scope Of Practice Determinations For Health Care Professions.
257.description: To implement the recommendation of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning scope of practice determinations for health care professionals.

258.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Government Administration and Elections
258.title: An Act Concerning The Military Facility Construction Or Acquisition Program.
258.description: To clarify the procedures by which the state may acquire or construct military facilities.

259.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
259.title: An Act Establishing Connecticut National Guard Training Accounts.
259.description: To establish two accounts for the Military Department to use to support morale and maintain state military training abilities.

260.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
260.title: An Act Concerning False Representation Of Military Status.
260.description: To provide that false representation of military rank is an offense and that false representation, by physical display, of rank, decoration or medals is an offense.

261.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
261.title: An Act Concerning Death Certificate Fees For Veterans.
261.description: To waive the fee for a death certificate when the deceased was a veteran and the person requesting the certificate is an immediate family member.

262.title: An Act Concerning Promotions For Retired Veterans.
262.description: To permit retired senior members of the Connecticut National Guard and the Governor's military staff who served honorably for thirty or more years to apply directly to the Adjutant General to be placed on the retired list at one grade above the highest grade they ever held.

263.title: An Act Concerning The Duties Of The Adjutant General.
263.description: To update and clarify the duties of the Adjutant General and to allow the Adjutant General to perform federal construction contracting on state land, subject to the approval of the Attorney General.

264.title: An Act Concerning The Expiration Of Driver's Licenses Issued To Members Of The Armed Forces.
264.description: To extend the validity of a driver's license held by a member of the armed forces serving on active duty out of state for thirty days after separation from service.

265.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
265.title: An Act Concerning Jury Duty Qualification For Members Of The Armed Forces On Active Duty And Their Spouses.
265.description: To exempt from jury duty members of the armed forces on active duty and their spouses who are the parents or legal guardians of children under sixteen years of age.

266.title: An Act Appropriating Funds For Building Maintenance Operating Costs At State Armories.
266.description: To allocate additional funds to the Military Department for building maintenance operating costs at state armories.

267.title: An Act Concerning Tax Assessments For Special Taxing Districts.
267.description: To permit special taxing districts to adopt a flat tax for the purpose of uniform residential real property assessment.

268.title: An Act Concerning Interest On Delinquent Property Taxes.
268.description: To give municipalities the option to charge interest at a rate not to exceed eighteen per cent per annum on delinquent property taxes.

269.title: An Act Concerning Foreclosure Mediation.
269.description: To extend the date of the termination of the foreclosure mediation program.

270.title: An Act Concerning Access To Records Of The Department Of Children And Families.
270.description: To revise and update laws related to the confidentiality of and access to the Department of Children and Families' records.

271.title: An Act Concerning Evidence Of Failure To Stop For A School Bus.
271.description: To provide that a still or video image of a vehicle passing a stopped school bus may constitute sufficient proof of the registration number of such vehicle so as to allow the owner thereof to be deemed the operator and charged with a violation.

272.title: An Act Concerning Eyewitness Identification.
272.description: To improve the reliability of eyewitness identification by establishing procedures for conducting a police photographic or live lineup including having a lineup administrator who does not know which person is suspected as the perpetrator, informing the eyewitness that the perpetrator might not be in the lineup and presenting the persons or photographs in a lineup sequentially rather than simultaneously.

273.title: An Act Concerning The Sale Of Firearms At Public Auction.
273.description: To encourage the sale of firearms and firearm parts or accoutrements at public auction as a source of revenue for the state.

274.title: An Act Eliminating A Requirement For A State Book Of Records Of Pistol And Revolver Sales.
274.description: To eliminate a requirement that vendors of pistols and revolvers keep a bound book to comply with state requirements because federal requirements require a similar bound book.

275.title: An Act Concerning Connecticut Based Microbreweries.
275.description: To promote the production and sale of Connecticut brewed beer.

276.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations
276.title: An Act Concerning Funding For Adult Day Care Centers.
276.description: To increase rates paid to adult day care centers.

277.title: An Act Concerning Senior Centers And The Freedom Of Information Act.
277.description: To exclude the names and addresses of members of senior centers and participants in senior center programs from Freedom of Information Act disclosure requirements.

278.last_action: Reported Out of Legislative Commissioners' Office
278.title: An Act Concerning The Real Estate Conveyance Tax.
278.description: To restore the exemption from the conveyance tax for transfers made pursuant to a foreclosure by sale and to exempt transfers of a transferor's principal residence when (1) the transfer is being made in lieu of a foreclosure, and (2) the transfer is a short sale.

279.title: An Act Concerning The Statute Of Limitations For Perjury.
279.description: To provide that there shall be no limitation of time within which a person may be prosecuted for perjury if the false statement related to the commission of a murder or other serious offense for which there is no statute of limitations.

280.title: An Act Concerning Amendments To The Connecticut Uniform Principal And Income Act.
280.description: To amend the Connecticut Uniform Principal and Income Act.

281.title: An Act Concerning Firefighters, Police Officers And Workers' Compensation Claims Pertaining To Certain Diseases.
281.description: To require the chairman of the Workers' Compensation Commission report to the General Assembly on the status of the workers' compensation system in the state.

282.title: An Act Concerning Timetables For Municipal Binding Arbitration.
282.description: To provide rigid timelines for the completion of municipal binding arbitrations.

283.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
283.title: An Act Concerning Domestic Violence Victims And Discriminatory Practices.
283.description: To designate individuals who are actual or perceived victims of domestic violence a protected class for employment purposes.

284.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Government Administration and Elections
284.title: An Act Concerning State Employees And Violence And Bullying In The Workplace.
284.description: To require that the Department of Administrative Services report the number of complaints of bullying or abusive conduct to the General Assembly.

285.title: An Act Concerning Licensure Of Master And Clinical Social Workers.
285.description: To establish Department of Public Health licensure for master social workers.

286.title: An Act Allowing The Production And Sale Of Acidified Food Products On Residential Farms.
286.description: To allow the production and sale of acidified food products on residential farms.

287.title: An Act Concerning Circulating Nurses.
287.description: To require that a circulating nurse be present during every surgical procedure that takes place in an operating room of a hospital or outpatient surgical facility.

288.title: An Act Concerning The Salaries Of The Chief Medical Examiner And The Deputy Medical Examiner.
288.description: To ensure the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner's personal services costs do not exceed budgeted levels.

289.title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of Vaccines By Licensed Pharmacists.
289.description: To expand upon the types of vaccines that licensed pharmacists may administer to adults.

290.title: An Act Concerning The Sharing Of Information Between The Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services And The Department Of Social Services As Relates To Medicaid Funded Services.
290.description: To allow the Commissioner of Mental Health and Addiction Services to enter into a memorandum of understanding with the Commissioner of Social Services concerning the sharing of certain information that will allow the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services to more efficiently deliver targeted case management services funded by the Medicaid program.

291.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommended Technical Changes To The Public Health Statutes.
291.description: To implement the Legislative Commissioners' Office's recommended technical revisions to various statutes.

292.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
292.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Regional Fire Schools.
292.description: To authorize bonding for the capital improvement of regional fire schools.

293.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety
293.title: An Act Concerning Lottery Winners Who Are Tax Delinquent.
293.description: To require tax delinquents to pay any taxes they owe the state prior to receiving any lottery winnings.

294.title: An Act Concerning The Purchasing Of Prescription Drugs By Nonstate Public Employers.
294.description: To allow nonstate public employers to join a state employee self-insured prescription drug plan.

295.title: An Act Concerning The Definition Of Medical Necessity.
295.description: To define the terms "medically necessary" and "medical necessity" for the purpose of the administration of the Medicaid program.

296.title: An Act Concerning Expansion Of The Primary Care Case Management Pilot Program.
296.description: To expand the primary care case management pilot program state-wide.

297.title: An Act Prohibiting Incentives From Automobile Glass Repair Shops.
297.description: To prohibit automobile glass repair shops, insurance companies and automobile physical damage appraisers from providing, offering, requesting, requiring or accepting a rebate, gift, prize or other item of value in exchange for using a certain automobile glass repair shop.

298.title: An Act Concerning The Streamlining Of The Unemployment Compensation Appeals Process.
298.description: To reduce the number of appeals in the unemployment compensation system by one level to streamline the process and provide a quicker final determination for both the claimant and employer.

299.title: An Act Concerning Hospital Charges For Uninsured Patients.
299.description: To limit the amount hospitals may charge patients without health insurance coverage and to require the Office of Health Care Access to post hospital pricemasters on the Department of Public Health's web site.

300.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Environment
300.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Municipal Solid Waste Management Services In Connecticut.
300.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning municipal solid waste management services in Connecticut.

301.title: An Act Implementing The Program Review And Investigations Committee's Recommendations Concerning An Action Plan To Improve Family Preservation And Support Programs.
301.description: To implement the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee's recommendations to require the Department of Children and Families to prepare and implement an action plan to improve the effectiveness of the department's family preservation and support programs.

302.title: An Act Requiring Reporting Of Certain Health Insurance Claims Denial Data.
302.description: To require managed care organizations to report claims denial data and to require the Insurance Department to include such data in the consumer report card and to post such data on its Internet web site.

303.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of Drop-in Child-care Operations At Health Clubs.
303.description: To permit licensed health clubs to establish on-site, drop-in supplementary child-care operations.

304.title: An Act Exempting From Regulation Certain Nonprofit Ambulance Services Or Companies.
304.description: To exempt an ambulance service or company that provides emergency medical services on a subscription basis and is a nonprofit volunteer organization from the provisions of title 38a of the general statutes.

305.title: An Act Concerning The Operation Of Child Day Care Centers And Group Day Care Homes In Public Schools.
305.description: To provide an exemption from the Department of Public Health's physical plant regulatory requirements to child day care centers and group day care homes that operate in public school buildings and exclusively serve school-age children.

306.title: An Act Concerning The Filling Of Prescriptions For Antiepileptic Drugs.
306.description: To prohibit a pharmacy upon the initial filling or renewal of a prescription for the treatment of epilepsy or prevention of seizures from substituting an antiepileptic drug or formulation of an antiepileptic drug for the prescribed drug without first obtaining the consent of the patient's practitioner to make such substitution.

307.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
307.title: An Act Establishing A Nonprofit Workers' Compensation Insurance Company.
307.description: To establish a nonprofit workers' compensation insurance company to serve as the workers' compensation insurance carrier of last resort for employers in the state.

309.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
309.title: An Act Concerning Placement Of Children And Youth When There Is Serious Risk Of Danger To Health And Safety.
309.description: To protect children and youth by delaying placement with a parent or guardian if there is a risk of danger to health and safety and to require recommendations regarding placement be part of the order issued by the court.

310.title: An Act Concerning The Best Interests Of Children And Youth.
310.description: To require a study of government organization providing services to children and youth.

311.title: An Act Concerning Child Day Care Services In Health Clubs.
311.description: To authorize the provision of child care services at health clubs.

312.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
312.title: An Act Concerning Visitation To Grandchildren.
312.description: To provide for visitation by grandparents in certain limited circumstances.

313.title: An Act Banning Cadmium In Children's Jewelry.
313.description: To phase out the use of certain chemicals in children's products and to ban cadmium in children's products.

314.title: An Act Concerning Education And The Reduction Of Domestic Violence.
314.description: To include teen dating violence and domestic violence education as part of the in-service training program for certified teachers, administrators and pupil personnel.

315.title: An Act Amending The Definition Of Resident Students.
315.description: To prevent boards of education from assigning low-performing students, students with behavioral problems and students who are over age for their grades in public high schools to adult education programs.

316.title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations By The Legislative Commissioners For Technical Revisions To The Education Statutes.
316.description: To make technical changes to the education statutes.

317.title: An Act Concerning School Resource Officers.
317.description: To develop a plan for a school resource officer training course.

318.title: An Act Concerning Recycling, Certain Solid Waste Management Reforms And Requirements For Solid Waste And Ash Residue Facilities.
318.description: To increase recycling, expand certain solid waste management disclosure requirements and facilitate the development of certain solid waste and ash residue facilities.

319.title: An Act Concerning The Enforcement Of Prohibited Actions Concerning Certain Invasive Plants.
319.description: To authorize conservation officers to enforce certain prohibitions concerning invasive plants.

320.title: An Act Concerning A Pilot Program For Municipal Primary Day Registration.
320.description: To establish a pilot program to permit same day registration for municipal primaries in 2011.

321.title: An Act Concerning Expenditure Thresholds For A Group Organized Solely For The Purpose Of Promoting The Success Or The Defeat Of A Referendum Question.
321.description: To raise the expenditure threshold that would require a group organized to promote the success or defeat of a referendum question to file as a political committee from one thousand to two thousand dollars.

322.title: An Act Requiring State Agency And Contractor Affirmative Action Plans To Be Submitted To The Department Of Administrative Services.
322.description: To allow the Department of Transportation to submit the affirmative action plan the department prepares for the federal government to the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities rather than being required to submit a duplicative state affirmative action plan.

323.title: An Act Concerning Divestment Of State Funds Invested In Companies Doing Business In Iran And Sudan.
323.description: To establish a process for possible divestment of state funds from companies doing business in Iran and to make conforming changes to the statute concerning divestment of state funds from companies doing business in Sudan.

324.title: An Act Concerning The Electronic Submission Of Reports.
324.description: To reduce wasteful printing costs by state agencies.

325.title: An Act Concerning The Appointment Of Investment Personnel By The Treasurer.
325.description: To provide the Treasurer the authority to appoint personnel with specialized skill sets.

326.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Education
326.title: An Act Expanding Certain Reverse Auction Authority To The Purchase Of Certain Services By Municipalities, School Districts And State Agencies.
326.description: Te expand the authority of municipalities, school districts and state agencies to use reverse auctions for the purchase of certain services.

327.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations
327.title: An Act Implementing Saga Hospital Rate Increases.
327.description: To implement the hospital rate increases under the state-administered general assistance program that are provided for in the budget.

328.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
328.title: An Act Concerning Reimbursement Rates To Physicians Who Provide Emergency Room Services To Medicaid Recipients.
328.description: To require separate reimbursement rates for emergency room physicians who provide services to Medicaid recipients.

329.title: An Act Concerning Connecticut's Economic Future.
329.description: To establish the Connecticut Economic Future Council to take state employee pension funds and to identify state bond allotments to fund state job creation.

330.title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Join In State Contracts For The Purchase Of Services.
330.description: To authorize municipalities to join in contracts with state agencies for the purchase of services.

331.title: An Act Establishing The Enfield Improvement District.
331.description: To establish the Enfield Improvement District.

332.title: An Act Concerning Absentee Ballots.
332.description: To clarify that municipal registrars are not required to purchase the National Change of Address System of the United States Postal Service to verify addresses of returned absentee ballots.

333.title: An Act Concerning The Streamlining Of State Grants.
333.description: To ensure prompt release of state grant funds.

334.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
334.title: An Act Delaying Implementation Of Provisions To Raise The Age Of Juvenile Court Jurisdiction.
334.description: To reduce burdens on municipalities by delaying the implementation of "raise the age" legislation.

335.title: An Act Encouraging Shared Service Agreements Between Boards Of Education.
335.description: To encourage two or more municipalities to enter into agreements for shared services.

336.title: An Act Authorizing Two Or More Municipalities Or Boards Of Education To Pursue Joint Employee Health Insurance Plans And Requiring Disclosures By Certain Insurance Producers.
336.description: To authorize two or more municipalities to pursue joint employee health insurance plans.

337.title: An Act Concerning Local Plans Of Conservation And Development.
337.description: To grant municipalities a two-year reprieve from a statutory obligation to update local plans of conservation and development.

338.title: An Act Concerning Notification Of Peace Officers Who Have Been Assaulted Prior To The Court Sentencing Or Accepting A Plea Agreement Of The Defendant.
338.description: To impose a mandatory minimum sentence of two years for assault of public safety, emergency medical or public transit personnel.

339.title: An Act Concerning Prizes For Teacup Raffles.
339.description: To remove the prohibitions against merchandise prizes worth more than a hundred dollars or cash prizes for teacup raffles.

340.title: An Act Concerning The Carrying Of Electronic Defense Weapons.
340.description: To allow the carrying of an electronic defense weapon pursuant to a permit to carry and to require a permit for the sale of electronic defense weapons.

341.title: An Act Concerning The Licensing And Record Keeping Of Pawnbrokers And Precious Metal And Stone Dealers, The Retention Of Certain Goods And Certain Fees Charged By Pawnbrokers.
341.description: To require pawnbrokers and precious metal and stone dealers to take photographs of jewelry and retain such jewelry for not less than ten days, to require pawnbrokers to keep computerized records, to permit pawnbrokers to charge a reasonable fee for issuing a memorandum or note and for the storage, insurance and appraisal of an item and to require a hearing prior to the revocation of a pawnbroker's license.

342.title: An Act Authorizing Keno.
342.description: To introduce keno in the state.

343.title: An Act Concerning The Nondisclosure Of Information Regarding Persons Arrested For Domestic Violence.
343.description: To prohibit police departments from releasing the names of persons arrested for domestic violence.

344.title: An Act Concerning Mailed Raffle Tickets.
344.description: To permit raffle tickets sent in the mail to contain a statement that a person may enter the raffle without paying for the raffle ticket.

345.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Well-being Of All Connecticut Children And Requiring An Annual Report Card Evaluating State Policies And Programs Impacting Children.
345.description: To implement a recommendation of the Legislative Program and Investigations Committee concerning the application of results-based accountability principles to selected human services programs.

346.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
346.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Review, Repeal And Modification Of Certain Tax Credits.
346.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning the review, repeal and modification of certain tax credits.

347.title: An Act Implementing Additional Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Retaliation For Whistleblower Complaints.
347.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning whistleblowers: To require the Attorney General and the Auditors of Public Accounts to post a summary of all complaints on their web site every six months, to require a more detailed report be submitted to the General Assembly, to extend the filing requirement for complaints to ninety days, to extend the rebuttable presumption period for retaliation complaints to two years, to allow human rights referees to grant temporary relief and to permit amendments to complaints, and to repeal the provision setting forth a process for requesting the Attorney General to investigate retaliation complaints.

348.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning A Strategic Plan And Coordination For Alignment Of Postsecondary Education And Employment.
348.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning a strategic plan and coordination for alignment of postsecondary education and employment.

349.title: An Act Concerning Licensure And Certification Credits For Military Training.
349.description: To provide credit or an exemption towards the requirements of a professional license or certificate for members of the armed forces who received substantively similar training or schooling during their military service.

350.title: An Act Concerning Prescription Drug Benefits For Veterans In Nursing Home Facilities.
350.description: To prohibit nursing home facilities from restricting patients from accessing prescription drug benefits offered through the United States Department of Veterans Affairs.

351.title: An Act Proclaiming March Thirtieth To Be Welcome Home Vietnam Veterans Day.
351.description: To commemorate the date of the return home of the last members of the armed forces who served in Vietnam by proclaiming March thirtieth of each year Welcome Home Vietnam Veterans Day.

352.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force On Traumatic Brain Injury.
352.description: To establish a task force to examine ways to develop and improve existing services for individuals with traumatic brain injury, including the unique needs and services for veterans with traumatic brain injury.

353.title: An Act To Provide Incentives For Hospitals To Adopt Electronic Health Records.
353.description: To obtain federal incentive funds for hospitals and eligible professionals to adopt electronic health records.

354.title: An Act Concerning An Advanced Dental Hygiene Practice Pilot Program.
354.description: To establish a pilot program to provide advanced dental hygienist practitioner services in public health facilities located in the city of Hartford.

355.title: An Act Concerning Purchase Of Service Contracts.
355.description: To require the Office of Policy and Management to standardize purchase of service contract policies and procedures.

356.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
356.title: An Act Concerning Changes To Certain Tax Credits To Enhance Their Use And To Repeal Certain Unutilized Tax Credits.
356.description: To repeal certain underutilized tax credits.

357.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
357.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To Economic Development Statutes.
357.description: To replace outdated references to the Standard Industrial Classification system with references to the North American Industrial Classification system, to redefine certain terms used in economic development statutes, to add to the Department of Economic and Community Development's reporting requirements, to provide direct funding to small businesses located in an incubator, and to make changes to entrepreneurial programs for dislocated workers and displaced homemakers.

358.title: An Act Requiring Permits Issued By The Department Of Environmental Protection Be Adopted In Accordance With The Uniform Administrative Procedures Act.
358.description: To require that the Department of Environmental Protection follow the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act in creating requirements for their permitting process.

359.title: An Act Concerning Children In The Recession.
359.description: To implement the recommendations of the task force on children in the recession.

360.title: An Act Establishing A Municipal And State Energy Efficiency And Improvement Program.
360.description: To establish a program to identify and deploy energy efficiency and clean technologies at state and municipal buildings.

361.title: An Act Concerning Renewable Energy.
361.description: To promote the use of renewable energy.

362.title: An Act Requiring Street Light Shutoffs.
362.description: To conserve energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions related to roadway lights.

363.title: An Act Concerning Virtual Net Metering.
363.description: To develop a virtual net metering program to allow electric distribution company customers who own Class I renewable energy sources and who use less energy than they generate to assign their unused credits.

364.title: An Act Concerning Electric Distribution Companies.
364.description: To enable electric distribution companies to own and operate renewable and distributed generation, to make changes to the Connecticut electric efficiency partner program, to provide for direct billing from electric suppliers, to allow electric distribution companies to terminate residential service on certain Fridays, and to enable electric distribution companies to notify certain state agencies when nursing home and long-term care facilities are at risk for service termination due to nonpayment.

365.title: An Act Concerning The Disqualification Of State Contractors.
365.description: To delete a limited provision concerning disqualification because there are more comprehensive statutes concerning disqualification, and to extend from two to five years the period that a state contractor may be disqualified.

366.title: An Act Concerning Veteran Tuition Waivers.
366.description: To clarify the definition of "service in time of war" for purposes of the tuition waivers offered to veterans.

367.title: An Act Concerning No Worker Left Behind.
367.description: To waive up to ten thousand dollars in tuition for individuals who meet certain eligibility criteria and enroll in a degree or certificate program in a high demand field, emerging industry or entrepreneurship program.

369.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
369.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Capital Improvements Of Moderate Rental Housing Operated By The Hartford Housing Authority.
369.description: To authorize bonds of the state for capital improvements of moderate rental housing operating by the Hartford Housing Authority.

370.title: An Act Concerning Affordable Housing Replacement.
370.description: To create a three-year pilot program permitting certain housing authorities receiving state financial assistance to replace dwelling units restricted for low and moderate-income families at a ratio of one replacement dwelling unit for every two dwelling units authorized to be sold, leased, transferred or destroyed.

371.title: An Act Concerning Visitable Housing.
371.description: To promote the development of accessible housing in the state.

372.title: An Act Concerning Establishing Residency For Tenants.
372.description: To limit the rights of occupants who are not listed on a rental agreement.

373.title: An Act Promoting And Sustaining Affordable Housing In Connecticut And Concerning Real Estate Licensing For Nonprofit Housing Corporations.
373.description: To require regional and local plans of conservation and development to include plans to promote and sustain affordable housing.

374.title: An Act Concerning Business Entity Filings.
374.description: To make revisions concerning the timing and manner of the filing of annual reports and other documents with the Secretary of the State by domestic and foreign corporations, limited partnerships, limited liability companies, limited liability partnerships and statutory trusts.

375.title: An Act Concerning The Revisor's Technical Corrections To The General Statutes.
375.description: To make various technical changes concerning grammar, clarity, accuracy of internal references and consistency in the general statutes.

376.title: An Act Adopting The Uniform Unsworn Foreign Declarations Act.
376.description: To adopt the Uniform Unsworn Foreign Declarations Act to permit, in state court proceedings, unsworn declarations under penalty of perjury to be executed by witnesses physically located outside the United States in lieu of affidavits, verifications or other sworn court filings.

377.title: An Act Concerning The Tolling Of Time Periods For Bringing A Dram Shop Action While Police Investigations Are Pending.
377.description: To provide that the time periods for giving notice of and bringing a dram shop action are suspended until a police investigation is completed or one year passes, whichever comes first.

378.title: An Act Concerning Offers Of Compromise In Arbitration Of Construction Contracts.
378.description: To authorize a claimant in an arbitration of a construction contract to file an offer of compromise.

379.title: An Act Concerning The Sexual Assault Of Persons Placed Or Treated Under The Direction Of The Commissioner Of Developmental Services.
379.description: To prohibit a person who has disciplinary or supervisory authority over a person placed or treated in a facility or program by the Commissioner of Developmental Services from engaging in sexual activity with such other person.

380.title: An Act Concerning Costs And Attorney's Fees In An Action Of Foreclosure Or Upon A Bond Substituted For A Mechanic's Lien.
380.description: To clarify provisions concerning the award of costs and attorney's fees in an action of foreclosure of a mortgage or lien or an action upon a bond which has been substituted for a mechanic's lien.

381.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
381.title: An Act Concerning Real Estate Licensing For Nonprofit Housing Corporations.
381.description: To exempt from real estate licensing requirements nonprofit housing corporations and employees that manage housing projects receiving federal low-income housing tax credits.

382.title: An Act Concerning Regional Economic Development.
382.description: To coordinate and promote regional economic development.

383.title: An Act Prohibiting Open Alcoholic Beverage Containers In Motor Vehicles.
383.description: To prohibit open alcoholic beverage containers in motor vehicles.

384.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Ignition Interlock Devices In Motor Vehicles.
384.description: To expand the use of ignition interlock devices in motor vehicles operated by persons convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol.

385.title: An Act Concerning The Safety Of Pedestrians And Cyclists And The Promotion Of Healthy Communities.
385.description: To establish a competitive grant program for awards to municipalities for projects that promote healthy communities and improve the safety of pedestrians and cyclists.

386.title: An Act Concerning The Removal Of Snow And Ice From Motor Vehicles.
386.description: To require the removal of snow and ice from motor vehicles.

387.title: An Act Concerning Homeless Female Veterans And Bilingual Service Officers.
387.description: To require a study of issues concerning homeless female veterans.

388.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
388.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Economic And Community Development's Recommendations For Tax Credits To Promote Job Creation.
388.description: To establish a set dollar amount for the credit to be received by employers for hiring a new employee and to clarify the job creation tax credit program statute.

389.title: An Act Concerning Fiscal Reforms.
389.description: To require the Office of Fiscal Analysis to recommend fiscal efficiencies for state agencies to the General Assembly.

390.title: An Act Concerning Quasi-public Agency Compliance Audits.
390.description: To permit compliance audits of quasi-public agencies to be conducted biennially, rather than annually.

391.title: An Act Concerning Nonappropriated Funds And Personnel Status Reports By Quasi-public Agencies.
391.description: To require quasi-public agencies to provide more detailed reporting on nonappropriated funds and agency personnel.

392.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of An Account To Fund The Twenty-seventh State Payroll Period.
392.description: To establish an account for payment of each twenty-seventh payroll. Requested by the State Comptroller.

393.title: An Act Increasing The Amount Of Unappropriated Surplus Deposited In The Budget Reserve Fund.
393.description: To increase the allowable amount of state funds in the Budget Reserve Fund.

394.title: An Act Concerning Benchmarks For State-funded Programs And Services.
394.description: To establish benchmarks to measure the effectiveness of state programs and services in meeting the needs of state residents and to terminate programs and services that are not working.

395.title: An Act Increasing Investment In Community Banks And Community Credit Unions.
395.description: To require the establishment of a program to increase investment in community banks and community credit unions.

397.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Transfer Of Hospital Patients Who Receive Medicaid Benefits To Nursing Homes.
397.description: To establish a pilot program to place recipients of Medicaid and state-administered general assistance benefits with chronic long-term health care needs in the most appropriate and cost-effective setting.

398.title: An Act Concerning Notice By The Department Of Social Services Regarding Repayment For Services.
398.description: To provide notice to recipients of benefits under programs administered by the Department of Social Services of their obligation, under certain circumstances, to provide repayment for such services.

399.title: An Act Concerning Reemployment Of Retired Teachers.
399.description: To allow an employing school district to place a retiree into a position for the entire school year.

400.title: An Act Making Clarifying Changes To The Teachers' Retirement System Statutes.
400.description: To delete obsolete language from the definition of deferred vested retirement and to clarify the language of the early retirement incentive plan.

401.title: An Act Concerning Expenses For Health Benefit Plans Under The Teachers' Retirement Fund.
401.description: To provide funding for consultants, including a health plan broker, in connection with the retired teachers' health benefit plans.

402.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Code Of Ethics.
402.description: To allow notaries public and justices of the peace to serve on the Citizen's Ethics Advisory Board, to stagger appointments to said board, to allow reappointments to the board, to permit members of said board to serve to adjudicate at a board hearing for a pending matter, to require prospective members of said board to certify that they are aware of the special restrictions of the Code of Ethics for Public Officials that would apply to them, to permit the Office of State Ethics to recover the amount of any financial benefit received by a state contractor for certain violations, to add a violation of section 1-101nn of the general statutes to the list of violations that are grounds for disqualifying a state contractor, to clarify that a violation of said section is grounds for being deemed a nonresponsible bidder, to give the Office of State Ethics the authority to interpret Parts III and IV of chapter 10 of the general statutes, to limit gift giving between supervisors and subordinates to one hundred dollars per year, to limit the violation contained in section 1-84 of the general statutes to knowing violations, to give the Office of State Ethics the ability to enforce the revolving door restrictions applying to former Gaming Policy Board members and Department of Public Utility Control Commissioners, to increase the threshold for lobbyist registration to $3,000, to require lobbyists to report gifts to state employees, to exempt candidates for public office from gift restrictions concerning admission to charitable and civic events or certain benefits provided by an employer, to limit certain lobbyist registration and reporting requirements to those who lobby within the scope of employment, to replace inaccurate references to the State Ethics Commission, to add other agencies to the definition of quasi-public agencies, to change certain reporting dates, to add employer other than the state to the conflict of interest provisions, and to require each prospective executive branch or quasi-public agency official or employee to sign a certification confirming their awareness of the applicable ethics laws.

403.title: An Act Concerning The Nondisclosure Of Certain Information Regarding Certain Employees To Inmates Under The Freedom Of Information Act.
403.description: To prohibit the disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act of certain information concerning employees of the Department of Correction to inmates.

404.title: An Act Concerning Verification Of Addresses On Returned Absentee Ballots.
404.description: To clarify that municipal registrars are not required to purchase the National Change of Address System of the United States Postal Service to verify addresses of returned absentee ballots.

405.title: An Act Concerning The Courts Of Probate.
405.description: To: (1) Require the adoption of probate court regulations concerning record maintenance, and delete provisions regarding adoption of regulations in accordance with chapter 54 of the general statutes, (2) permit a court of probate to hear matters outside the probate district, but within the state, to facilitate attendance by a party, (3) allow towns within a probate district to allocate expenses pursuant to agreement or in proportion to their grand lists, and (4) make a technical change.

406.title: An Act Concerning Probate Fees And The Recording Of Probate Proceedings.
406.description: To revise provisions concerning probate court fees and payment methods for such fees.

407.title: An Act Concerning Probate Court Operations.
407.description: To make changes to the probate statutes related to the redistricting of probate courts, probate court reforms and the office of the Probate Court Administrator.

408.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary
408.title: An Act Concerning Debt Settlement Services.
408.description: To require individuals or entities providing debt settlement services in this state to be licensed, meet certain surety bond, surety bond substitute or insurance policy requirements and comply with various requirements with regard to the debt settlement services provided.

409.title: An Act Concerning Modifications To The Foreclosure Mediation Program.
