409.description: To make certain modifications to the foreclosure mediation program, including the elimination of the sunset date of June 30, 2010, to adopt as state law the central protections for tenants after foreclosure contained in the federal Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009, to clarify the Cash for Keys Act, and to allow for a foreclosure by market sale.

410.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
410.title: An Act Concerning Medicaid.
410.description: To require the Commissioner of Social Services to amend the Medicaid state plan to include podiatry services and treatment for smoking cessation, to make changes to the composition and duties of the Medicaid managed care council and to require the Commissioner of Social Services to apply for a waiver under Section 1115 of the Social Security Act to benefit the Connecticut home care program for the elderly.

411.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
411.title: An Act Transferring Hospital Uncompensated Care Funds And Urban Disproportionate Share Hospital Funds Into The Fund For Hospital Medicaid Rates.
411.description: To move hospital uncompensated care funds and urban disproportionate share hospital funds into the fund for hospital Medicaid rates.

412.title: An Act Concerning Temporary Assistance For Needy Families Emergency Contingency Funds.
412.description: To review the programs administered by state agencies providing social services.

413.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures For The Programs And Services Of The Department Of Education.
413.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by the Department of Education.

414.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The General Fund.
414.description: To review appropriations from the General Fund.

415.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The Department Of Higher Education And The Constituent Units Of Higher Education.
415.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by the Department of Higher Education and the constituent units of higher education.

416.title: An Act Concerning An Open Space Registry, The Identification Of Open Space For Acquisition And The Recording Of Certain Open Space Restrictions.
416.description: To establish a central registry for land preserved as open space and farmland, enable municipalities to impose a conveyance tax on certain real property sales in order to generate funds for the preservation of open space and to require the development of trails for use by all-terrain vehicle operators.

417.title: An Act Concerning Integrated Pest Management Plans For Municipal Facilities.
417.description: To require each municipality to adopt an integrated pest management plan for facilities under its control.

418.title: An Act Concerning Farms, Food And Jobs.
418.description: To encourage job growth and expansion in the agriculture sector.

419.title: An Act Concerning The Transition From The Ten Mil Program In 2011.
419.description: To enable the continued preservation and tax treatment of certain forest land.

420.title: An Act Concerning Educators And Administrators.
420.description: To establish an alternate route to certification program for administrators and superintendents; to allow teaching experience in a nonpublic school as counting towards eligibility requirements for the issuance of a professional educator certificate; to permit student teaching experience in a nonpublic school to count towards the eligibility requirements for an initial educator certificate; and to include scientifically-based reading research models as part of the in-service training for certified personnel.

421.title: An Act Concerning Minor Revisions To The Education Statutes.
421.description: To change the Commissioner of Education's reporting requirement on the operation of charter schools from annually to biennially; to amend the reporting requirement that local school boards submit a financial statement of expenditures for their participation in the school breakfast grant program; to reduce the Youth Service Bureau reporting requirement from annually to biennially; to establish a task force to conduct an investigational study of the efficacy of the mandatory annual postural screenings for students in grades five to nine, inclusive.

422.title: An Act Concerning Dissection Choice.
422.description: To allow students to opt out of classroom experiments or dissections on animals upon raising a conscientious objection.

423.title: An Act Concerning Agreements Between Municipalities And Boards Of Education For The Joint Purchase Of Employee Health Insurance And The Disclosure Of Certain Information Regarding Compensation For Services Provided By Insurance Producers.
423.description: To allow two or more boards of education to jointly purchase health insurance for their employees.

424.title: An Act Concerning Special Education.
424.description: To reconstitute the State Advisory Council for Special Education by reducing the number of members to make it consistent with federal law; to require boards of education to provide applied behavior analysis services to certain special education students; to establish that the burden of proof lies with the party requesting a special education hearing; and to require the school district from which a child transfers to pay for such child's special education costs for the remainder of the school year.

425.title: An Act Concerning Individualized Educational Programs.
425.description: To address problems associated with the individualized education program form.

426.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of The Secretary Of The State, Business Entity Filings And The Office Of State Ethics.
426.description: To allow for certain cost saving measures within the office of the Secretary of the State.

427.title: An Act Concerning The Powers And Duties Of The State Elections Enforcement Commission And Revisions To Election Laws.
427.description: To augment the powers of the State Elections Enforcement Commission, to make violation of the "Voter's Bill of Rights" subject to penalty, to provide monetary fines for the failure to file a candidate intent affidavit under the Citizens' Election Program, to eliminate an obsolete reference to the lever voting machines and to require that any voting system used in an election be operational at the time the polls open, to lower the threshold for electronic filings to the State Elections Enforcement Commission and to remove references to certain software programs and replace them with references to the web-based program, to extend the State Elections Enforcement Commission review period for grant applications for candidates for state-wide offices, to provide that a participating candidate facing an opponent on the statutory deadline for nomination shall be deemed opposed for the election campaign and to repeal section 9-717.

428.title: An Act Concerning The Burden Of Proof In Juvenile Matters.
428.description: To raise the burden of proof in juvenile cases.

429.title: An Act Concerning The Transfer Of Children And Youth From Out-of-state Residential Facilities To Therapeutic Group Homes And Other Facilities In The State.
429.description: To require the Commissioner of Children and Families to develop a plan to transfer children and youth residing in out-of-state residential facilities to therapeutic group homes in the state.

430.title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of Programs Involving The Department Of Social Services.
430.description: To require the Department of Social Services to develop a plan to improve health care for premature infants, to provide notice to child support obligors in Title IV-D cases of their right to request review of a child support order in the event of incarceration or change in employment, to require the Commissioner of Social Services to make supplemental quality enhancement grant funds available to child care providers by August first each year, and to change the food bank handling charge.

431.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Children And Families.
431.description: To allow the Department of Children and Families to request modification of a child support order on behalf of a child who is a member of a family with service needs and to establish a presumption that it is in the best interest of a child to be in the custody of a parent who is a victim of domestic violence in proceedings involving the child's custody.

432.title: An Act Adjusting Insurance Guaranty Fund Credits.
432.description: To adjust the premium tax liability offset of assessments paid by insurance companies to the Connecticut Insurance Guaranty Association and the Connecticut Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association.

433.title: An Act Concerning The Common Interest Ownership Act.
433.description: To make various technical changes recommended by the Legislative Commissioners' Office concerning grammar, clarity, accuracy of internal references and consistency in the Common Interest Ownership Act.

434.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
434.title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Majority Leaders' Job Growth Roundtable.
434.description: To implement the recommendations of the Majority Leaders' Job Growth Roundtable.

435.title: An Act Concerning Brownfield Remediation Liability.
435.description: To facilitate the development of brownfields.

436.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
436.title: An Act Concerning Funding For Brownfield Remediation And Development.
436.description: To ensure the Office of Brownfield Remediation and Development has adequate funding.

437.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
437.title: An Act Studying The Effect Of The Repeal Of The Corporation Business Tax.
437.description: To create a task force to study the effect on the state of the repeal of the corporation business tax.

438.title: An Act Concerning Urban Site Remediation.
438.description: To provide state funds to cover a nonprofit economic development organization's expenses for directors' and liability insurance and certain administrative costs.

439.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Public Safety
439.title: An Act Concerning An Electric Vehicle Infrastructure.
439.description: To promote and incentivize the use of electric and hybrid vehicles in Connecticut and to support such vehicles.

440.title: An Act Concerning Certain Revisions To Elections Related Statutes And Concerning Participation By The Staff And Members Of The Citizen's Ethics Advisory Board In Political Campaigns.
440.description: To make certain revisions to elections related statutes.

441.title: An Act Concerning Absentee Voting By Members Of The Military And By Citizens Living Abroad.
441.description: To amend statutes in conformance with the federal Military and Overseas Voter Empowerment Act.

442.title: An Act Concerning Parental Rights In Juvenile Matters.
442.description: To require the Department of Children and Families to (1) verify the truth, accuracy and sufficiency of allegations before commencing an investigation, (2) provide notice to parents and guardians of their rights when interacting with the department, and (3) disclose complaints alleging neglect or abuse to the parent or guardian.

443.title: An Act Concerning Retirement Credit For Prior State Service For Probate Judges And Employees.
443.description: To allow a probate court judge or employee to receive credit in the probate retirement system for other state service, and to limit such state service credit to three years.

444.title: An Act Concerning The Death Penalty.
444.description: To revise the process for seeking post-conviction relief in death penalty cases and adopt the recommendations of the Connecticut Commission on the Death Penalty submitted to the General Assembly in January, 2003.

445.title: An Act Concerning Mass Gatherings.
445.description: To provide municipalities with the discretion to exempt certain mass gatherings from statutory licensure requirements.

446.title: An Act Concerning The Certificate Of Need Process.
446.description: To amend various statutes concerning the certificate of need process.

447.title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of The Department Of Developmental Services.
447.description: To enact various statutory changes concerning the internal administration of the Department of Developmental Services and entities that are under the auspices of said department.

448.title: An Act Concerning The Retail Sale Of Cigarettes And Tobacco Products.
448.description: To require that cigarettes and other tobacco products be sold in a manner that requires the assistance of retail personnel in order to effectuate the sale of such products.

449.title: An Act Concerning Expedited Partner Therapy For Sexually Transmitted Diseases.
449.description: To allow prescribing practitioners to prescribe and dispense antibiotics to the sexual partners of patients infected with chlamydia or gonorrhea without physical examination of the partners.

450.title: An Act Concerning The Operation Of Blood Drives.
450.description: To enact professional standards concerning the operation of blood drives and to permit sixteen year olds to donate blood without the consent of a parent or guardian.

451.title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Volunteer Health Care Services On A Temporary Basis.
451.description: To encourage the provision of charitable medical care at events held throughout the state by allowing the Commissioner of Public Health to temporarily suspend licensure, certification and registration requirements that would otherwise be applicable to health care professionals volunteering their services at such events.

452.title: An Act Concerning Statutory And Regulatory Provisions Relating To Recreational Vehicle Franchises.

453.title: An Act Concerning The Numbers And Letters Contained On Motor Vehicle Number Plates.
453.description: To authorize the issuance of motor vehicle number plates containing up to seven numbers or letters.

454.title: An Act Concerning The Master Transportation Plan, The Facilities Assessment Report, The Connecticut Pilot And Maritime Commissions, A Review Of The State Traffic Commission And Changes To The Stamford Transportation Center, And Requiring New Crosswalks To Provide Time For The Safe Crossing Of Pedestrians.
454.description: To update sections 13b-15 and 13b-16 of the general statutes to reflect changes in state and federal laws.

455.title: An Act Eliminating Reimbursement To Members Of The Connecticut Pilot Commission And The Connecticut Maritime Commission, And Providing Staff Support To The Connecticut Pilot Commission.
455.description: To eliminate reimbursement to members of the Connecticut Pilot Commission and the Connecticut Maritime Commission, and provide staff support to the Connecticut Pilot Commission. Requested by the Department of Transportation.

456.title: An Act Concerning Penalties For Harm To Vulnerable Users Of A Public Way.
456.description: To protect vulnerable users of a public way by enhancing penalties for operators of motor vehicles whose careless driving causes serious physical injury or death to a pedestrian, bicyclist or other vulnerable user of a public way.

457.title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of A Certificate Of Title To A Person Who Is Designated The Beneficiary Of A Motor Vehicle.
457.description: To authorize the issuance of a certificate of title, without requiring the issuance of a certificate of registration, to a person who is the beneficiary of a motor vehicle and does not intend to operate such vehicle.

458.title: An Act Concerning Wreckers.
458.description: To change the requirements for lights installed on wreckers, to remove references to "disabled or wrecked vehicle" being towed or transported "for compensation" and to establish a fee for moving wrecked, disabled or inoperable vehicles out of storage premises.

459.title: An Act Concerning The Transportation Strategy Board.
459.description: To provide the Transportation Strategy Board with greater independence, increase the membership of the board to include the chairpersons and ranking members of the transportation committee and require the board to submit a revised strategic plan to the General Assembly.

460.title: An Act Providing Additional Time For The Repair And Free Reinspection Of A Motor Vehicle Following The Failure Of Such Vehicle To Comply With Emissions Standards.
460.description: To provide additional time for the repair and free reinspection of a motor vehicle following the failure of such vehicle to comply with emissions standards, in the case of economic hardship of the owner.

461.title: An Act Concerning Mobile Telephone Charges.
461.description: To ensure mobile telephone customers are notified that services not purchased may still be available and charged at a higher, per-use rate.

462.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
462.title: An Act Concerning Periodic Review Of Video Providers.
462.description: To provide a regular review of each person, entity or company holding a certificate of public convenience and necessity to provide community antenna television service, a certificate of cable franchise authority or a certificate of video franchise authority.

463.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Encouragement Of Renewable Energy Projects.
463.description: To provide a way for municipalities to encourage renewable energy projects.

464.title: An Act Concerning The Development Of Green Jobs.
464.description: To implement the recommendations of the speaker of the House of Representative's Green Jobs Working Group.

465.title: An Act Concerning Climate Change.
465.description: To give the General Assembly a measureable way to evaluate greenhouse gas reduction programs and expenditures.

466.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
466.title: An Act Concerning Customer Rebates For Electricity Ratepayers.
466.description: To coordinate and centralize energy efficiency programs.

467.title: An Act Concerning Technical Changes To Utility Statutes.
467.description: To make technical changes to utility statutes.

468.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology
468.title: An Act Concerning Cable Subscriber Rights.
468.description: To ensure consistent channel offerings for cable and satellite television customers throughout the channels contract negotiation period.

469.title: An Act Concerning The State Elections Enforcement Commission And Campaign Treasurers.
469.description: To provide for a waiver of late filing fees for certain disclosures and certifications to campaign treasurers experiencing hardship, to require the State Election and Enforcement Commission to inform campaign treasurers of changes to elections laws and regulations and to require the commission to respond to telephonic questions from campaign treasurers with a written response.

470.title: An Act Concerning Independent Expenditures.
470.description: To provide that independent expenditures made by an entity are properly disclosed and ensure that such expenditures are properly attributed to the entity making the expenditure.

471.title: An Act Concerning Pawnbrokers, Precious Metal Dealers And Second-hand Dealers.
471.description: To revise the licensing and business practice requirements for persons engaged in the business of pawnbrokers, precious metal dealers or second-hand dealers.

472.title: An Act Concerning Actions To Recover Damages For The Sexual Abuse, Sexual Exploitation Or Sexual Assault Of A Minor.
472.description: To protect children by eliminating the statute of limitations for an action to recover damages for the sexual abuse, sexual exploitation or sexual assault of a minor and by eliminating the homestead exemption in such cases.

473.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
473.title: An Act Requiring The Preparation Of A Plan For The Establishment Of Electronic Tolls.
473.description: To establish tolls at Connecticut's borders and create a source of revenue for the Connecticut's Special Transportation Fund.

474.title: An Act Concerning Dental Care For Nursing Home Residents.
474.description: To require that nursing homes provide their residents with adequate supervision and assistance during dental care appointments.

475.title: An Act Concerning Pathology Billing Practices.
475.description: To repeal statutory prohibitions applicable to health care providers who, in the course of their practice, bill for the provision of anatomic pathology services.

476.title: An Act Concerning The Clean Water Act And Stream Flow Regulations.
476.description: To prohibit the Department of Public Health from requiring septic tanks and subsurface sewage disposal systems to be inspected or pumped at regular intervals, to require the Department of Environmental Protection to conduct a study of basins in the state to assess the impact by proposed stream flow regulations, to require the Commissioner of Public Health to examine the impact of stream flow regulations on public water supplies, and to require the Department of Public Utility Control to initiate a docket to examine the potential impact of stream flow regulations on water company ratepayers.

477.title: An Act Concerning A Property Tax Exemption For Motor Vehicles Leased By Disabled Persons.
477.description: To allow a property tax exemption for motor vehicles leased by persons with disabilities.

478.title: An Act Concerning The Amortization Schedule For Bonds Issued By Municipalities.
478.description: To allow flexibility in the amortization schedule for municipal bonds, which will allow municipalities to issue debt within existing resources and provide a more stable and predictable mill levy over the life of the bond.

479.title: An Act Permitting A Regional Sales Tax.
479.description: To allow regional planning organizations to impose a sales tax as a source of revenue.

480.title: An Act Concerning The Collection And Remittance Of The Sales Tax By Remote Sellers.
480.description: To specify that sales tax is due when an online retailer uses an in-state affiliate to sell its products.

481.title: An Act Extending The Deadline For Certain Tax Credits And Exemptions.
481.description: To provide an extension of the filing dates for certain property tax exemptions, and provide a one-time exemption, allowing credits in an amount greater than one hundred fifty thousand dollars to be awarded under the Neighborhood Assistance Program.

482.title: An Act Concerning A Regional Hotel Tax.
482.description: To allow regional planning organizations to impose a hotel tax as a source of revenue.

483.title: An Act Concerning The Failure Of A Witness To Report A Serious Crime Committed Against A Child.
483.description: To require a person who witnesses a serious crime being committed against a child under sixteen years of age to report that crime to a law enforcement official.

484.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of The Victim Advocate.
484.description: To require the advisory committee to the Office of the Victim Advocate to make recommendations to the General Assembly on how to improve the effectiveness of the office in carrying out its responsibilities.

485.title: An Act Concerning Residency Restrictions For Registered Sexual Offenders.
485.description: To protect children from convicted sexual offenders by requiring that convicted sexual offenders reside at least two thousand feet away from a school or child care center.

486.title: An Act Concerning The Open Choice Program.
486.description: To increase the state funding to school districts receiving open choice program students.

487.title: An Act Concerning The Study Of Interdistrict Education Programs.
487.description: To require a study of issues involving interdistrict education programs in Connecticut.

488.title: An Act Concerning Secondary School Reform.
488.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations committee concerning alignment of post-secondary education and employment.

489.title: An Act Concerning The Minimum Budget Requirement And Various Education Grants.
489.description: To allow school districts whose student population has declined to reduce the budgeted appropriation for education for purposes of the minimum budget requirement and to make a revision to the equalization aid grant for East Hartford.

490.title: An Act Concerning Certain School District Reforms To Reduce The Achievement Gap In Connecticut.
490.description: To allow parents to vote to restructure a school that has been identified as in need of improvement pursuant to the federal No Child Left Behind Act; to establish an income tax reimbursement pilot competitive grant program for teachers in priority school districts; to include student academic growth as a factor in educator performance evaluations; to create an online credit recovery program for school districts with dropout rates of eight per cent or greater; to require school districts to conduct two parent-teacher conferences per school year; to establish a task force responsible for examining the achievement gap in Connecticut; to change the date of counting students for purposes of ECS from October first to March first and to require school districts to implement an advanced placement course program.

491.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Accountability Statutes.
491.description: To amend the accountability statute for schools and districts in need of improvement by allowing the State Board of Education to require the local or regional board of education for such schools or districts to adopt new high school graduation requirements, collect student information regarding career and academic choices, and to conduct examinations at the end of the school year for certain courses.

492.title: An Act Concerning Strategic Planning In State Education Policy And Charter School Funding.
492.description: To amend the statutes concerning the funding mechanism for state charter schools by allowing state charter schools to be eligible for state funding to the same extent as local and regional boards of education.

493.title: An Act Concerning Various Changes To Title 12 And To The Tax Credit Program For Rehabilitation Of Certified Historic Structures.
493.description: To make various clarifying changes to Title 12 of the general statutes, including (1) disallowing expenses paid to a captive REIT as a deduction, (2) requiring receipt by the Department of Revenue Services of a processible return prior to any determination of interest on an overpayment of taxes, (3) allowing notice of cancellation of sales tax permit to be sent by regular mail, (4) exempting in-state motor carriers only from filing a certain quarterly statement, (5) making procedural and technical changes to the Neighborhood Assistance Act, (6) imposing the requirement of electronically paying taxes at a lower threshold of tax liability, and (7) repealing three obsolete sections.

494.title: An Act Establishing The River Falls Improvement District Within The Town Of Seymour.
494.description: To create the River Falls Improvement District within the town of Seymour.

495.title: An Act Concerning Restraining Orders For The Protection Of Family Violence Victims In The Workplace.
495.description: To permit employers to seek restraining orders to protect employees from threats or violence at the workplace of the employer.

496.title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Speaker Of The House Of Representatives' Task Force On Domestic Violence.
496.description: To implement employment protections, electronic monitoring of offenders, court procedures and other protections for victims of family violence.

497.title: An Act Concerning State Contracts For Micro Businesses, Utility Deposits For Connecticut Businesses, The Set Aside Of Department Of Transportation Contracts For Small Businesses, Grants For Regional Revolving Loan Programs For Microenterprises, And The Issuance Of Eligibility Certificates For Certain Economic Development Programs.
497.description: To facilitate micro businesses participation in state contracts, examine excessive business utility deposits and provide loan funds to the state's small businesses.

498.title: An Act Concerning The Promotion Of Business.
498.description: To modify certain state agency regulations in order to promote business in the state.

499.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of Small Business Affairs And Establishing The Small Business Advisory Board.
499.description: To expand the duties of the Office of Small Business Affairs and to establish a Small Business Advisory Board.

500.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
500.title: An Act Concerning The S.a.f.e. Act 2009.
500.description: To provide access to business credit for certain qualified Connecticut businesses and balance sheet liquidity for Connecticut banks.

501.title: An Act Concerning Habeas Corpus Reform.
501.description: To revise the process for the filing and disposition of applications for a writ of habeas corpus that challenges the validity of a conviction, sentence or commitment.

502.title: An Act Concerning Subpoenas For Property.
502.description: To give state prosecutors the tools necessary to protect state residents and government funds and programs from fraud.

503.title: An Act Concerning Siting Of Cell Phone Towers Near Schools.
503.description: To prevent cell phone towers from being installed near schools.

504.title: An Act Concerning Electric Rate Relief.
504.description: To implement the recommendations of the Speaker's Rate Relief Panel.

505.title: An Act Concerning The Taxation Of Telecommunications Company Property And Utility Deposits For Business Customers.
505.description: To require owners of property used in rendering telecommunications services to provide its list of property in each municipality by November thirtieth each year and to revise current utility security deposit requirements for businesses.

506.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary
506.title: An Act Concerning Consumer Protections In The Retail Electricity Market.
506.description: To eliminate the requirement that electric distribution companies maintain a referral service or offer to send bills for competitive electric suppliers and to amend definitions and statutes related to electric suppliers, aggregators and brokers.

507.title: An Act Establishing The Division Of Electricity Policy And Procurement.
507.description: To establish a Division of Electricity Policy and Procurement.

508.title: An Act Concerning Public Access Television And The Definition Of Public Service Companies.
508.description: To improve community access television in the state and remove holders of a certificate of cable franchise authority from the definition of a public service company.

509.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
509.title: An Act Concerning The Disposition Of Surplus State Property.
509.description: To assist the state in making an informed decision regarding the disposition of surplus lands and buildings, to involve regional councils of governments in the process for such disposition, to allow the Department of Economic and Community Development to recommend the use of such land for economic development and to require the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management to obtain a cost-benefit analysis concerning such disposition.

510.title: An Act Concerning Corporations' And Organizations' Financial Influence On Elections.
510.description: To require the State Elections Enforcement Commission to review the provisions of title 9 of the general statutes and evaluate whether such provisions should be amended in light of the United States Supreme Court decision, Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission.

511.title: An Act Concerning The Freedom Of Information Act.
511.description: To add a reference to the definition of the Freedom of Information Act.

512.title: An Act Concerning Investigation Of Duplication In State Government.
512.description: To make technical changes to the statute concerning the Governor's power to investigate duplication in state government.

513.title: An Act Concerning State Agency Reports.
513.description: To require only one copy of reports to be filed with the State Librarian.

514.title: An Act Concerning Government Efficiency Through Regionalization In Connecticut.
514.description: To provide for the regionalization of state and municipal services.

515.title: An Act Concerning A Pilot Program Of The Department Of Administrative Services.
515.description: To provide for greater administrative efficiency by state agencies.

516.title: An Act Concerning Ethics And The Office Of The State Treasurer.
516.description: To require investment services firms to provide the State Treasurer a written disclosure of contributions made or solicited by its principals or its political committee prior to contracting with the State Treasurer.

517.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of State Ethics.
517.description: To change an obsolete reference to the commission to the Office of State Ethics.

518.title: An Act Concerning Licensing And Permitting Processes For Certain Projects.
518.description: To make technical changes to the statute concerning licenses or permits for a downtown higher education center project or a riverfront infrastructure development and improvement project.

519.title: An Act Concerning The Conveyance Of Certain Parcels Of State Land.
519.description: To facilitate the conveyance of certain parcels of state land to municipalities.

520.title: An Act Concerning Child Welfare And The Juvenile Justice System And Erasure Of Juvenile Records.
520.description: To: (1) Revise detention provisions with respect to children in the juvenile justice system, (2) revise record retention and erasure requirements with respect to delinquency and family with service needs proceedings in the Superior Court, and (3) require annual reports from designated agencies regarding disproportionate minority contact in the juvenile justice system.

521.title: An Act Concerning Juvenile Matters.
521.description: To (1) revise provisions regarding children and youth in juvenile matters with respect to medical, mental health and other records, reports by the Department of Children and Families to the court, and escape from custody provisions, and (2) make technical, conforming and clarifying changes with respect to the increase in the age of juvenile jurisdiction.

522.title: An Act Concerning Reentry.
522.description: To consider establishing a state tax credit for private-sector employers who hire persons recently released from prison, adjust census data to count persons incarcerated in correctional institutions in the population count of the towns where they resided prior to incarceration and prohibit the state, political subdivisions of the state and employers that contract with the state and such political subdivisions from inquiring about a job applicant's criminal record until such time as the applicant has been conditionally offered a position.

523.title: An Act Concerning Criminal Records And Sentence Review.
523.description: To limit the disclosure of criminal records of certain inmates of the Department of Correction and allow defendants who pled guilty to an offense to seek sentence review.

524.title: An Act Concerning Pardons.
524.description: To provide that a provisional pardon becomes an absolute pardon after a specified time period if the person is not convicted of another crime during that time period.

525.title: An Act Concerning Standards For The Selection, Retention And Promotion Of Judicial Marshals.
525.description: To require the Judicial Department to make available on its Internet web site a written summary of employment standards for judicial marshals.

526.title: An Act Concerning State Marshals.
526.description: To authorize process to be served on a member or manager of a limited liability company, limit when process may be directed to an indifferent person, allow service outside a marshal's precinct in certain situations, limit the time period for bringing an action against a state marshal, clarify when process must be delivered to a marshal or other officer and require a party summoning a witness to pay the fees of the witness.

527.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Research And Development Tax Credits For Projects In Enterprise Zones.
527.description: To permit the transfer of research and development tax credits to encourage commercial or residential development projects in enterprise zones.

528.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From The Admissions Tax At Rentschler Field.
528.description: To provide an exemption from the admissions tax for any not-for-profit entity that conducts events at Rentschler Field.

529.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Business Corporation Act.
529.description: To revise the Connecticut Business Corporation Act.

530.title: An Act Concerning The Admissibility Of Medical Bills In Civil Actions.
530.description: To provide that evidence that a health care provider accepted a reduced amount of payment shall not be admissible for determining economic damages in civil actions.

531.title: An Act Concerning Prejudgment Remedies.
531.description: To clarify the original intent of law and limit the application of prejudgment remedies to contractual disputes by prohibiting application of prejudgment remedies in pure tort claims.

532.title: An Act Concerning Sexting.
532.description: To protect children from the dangers and consequences of inappropriate use of technology.

533.title: An Act Establishing A Revenue Accountability Commission.
533.description: To establish a revenue accountability commission comprised of persons with a wide variety of backgrounds and knowledge, to conduct a thorough review of the revenue streams upon which the state's budget depends and to make appropriate recommendations for improvements.

535.title: An Act Concerning The Dram Shop Act.
535.description: To limit dram shop liability to situations where the seller purveys or furnishes alcoholic liquor directly to an intoxicated person.

536.title: An Act Concerning Certificates Of Merit.
536.description: To revise provisions concerning certificates of merit and opinions and testimony of health care providers in medical malpractice actions.

537.title: An Act Concerning Product Liability Claims For Commercial Loss.
537.description: To permit a commercial party to bring a product liability claim for commercial loss.

538.title: An Act Concerning Judicial Branch Powers And Procedures.
538.description: To make certain revisions concerning the powers and procedures of the Judicial Branch, including appellate procedures, emergency powers of the Chief Justice and Chief Court Administrator, probation violations, diversionary programs, juvenile matters, victim services and courthouses, and to make certain revisions concerning the duties and responsibilities of the Criminal Justice Information System Governing Board and the executive director of the board.

539.title: An Act Concerning The Compensation Of Judges, Family Support Magistrates, Family Support Referees And Judge Trial Referees.
539.description: To create a mechanism whereby increases in the salaries of judges and family support magistrates and in the per diem rates paid to senior judges, judge trial referees and family support referees are linked to the average increase in compensation afforded to executive branch managers.

540.title: An Act Concerning Juror Service And Selection.
540.description: To: (1) Permit noncitizens, full-time students and small business owners to be excluded from the juror summoning process, and (2) require the Jury Administrator to summon each juror to a court location that is in a judicial district that includes the town in which the juror resides.

542.description: To regulate the ownership of inventions and discoveries of employees of the Connecticut Agricultural Experiment Station.

654.title: An Act Eliminating The Sunset For Certain Tax Incremental Financing Programs.
654.description: To eliminate the sunset dates for certain tax incremental financing programs.

655.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
655.title: An Act Concerning An Appropriation To The Commission On The Arts For Use On Capitol Projects At The Warner Theater.
655.description: To provide a grant to the Commission on the Arts to provide the Warner Theater funding for capitol projects.

656.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
656.title: An Act Appropriating Funds To The Department Of Economic And Community Development To Develop Senior Congregate Housing In Wilton Commons.
656.description: To appropriate funds for senior congregate housing in Wilton.

657.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
657.title: An Act Creating Tax Credits For Employers Who Hire Disabled Persons.
657.description: To provide tax incentives for employers to hire disabled persons.

658.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment
658.title: An Act Authorizing Sunday Bow Hunting On Private Property.
658.description: To authorize Sunday bow hunting on private property.

659.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment
659.title: An Act Reducing The Recent Increase In Hunting And Fishing License Fees And Increasing Certain Motor Vehicle Fees.
659.description: To reduce the recent increase in hunting and fishing license fees and offset the reduction in such revenues with an increase in certain motor vehicle fees.

660.title: An Act Concerning Camping Fees Paid By State Residents And Nonresidents And Authorizing Certain Hunting Of Deer By Pistol And Revolver.
660.description: To lower camping fees for state residents from their current levels, increase camping fees for nonresidents from their current levels and authorize the hunting of deer by pistol or revolver under certain conditions.

661.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment
661.title: An Act Concerning Youth Fees For Hunting And Fishing Licenses.
661.description: To ease the burden of the recent increase in hunting and fishing license fees.

662.title: An Act Concerning Connecticut Qualified Biodiesel Producer Grants.
662.description: To encourage the growth of the biodiesel industry in Connecticut.

663.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
663.title: An Act Concerning Remediation Programs Of The Department Of Environmental Protection.
663.description: To establish a system of notices of activity and use limitation for certain contaminated properties in order to facilitate the future use of such properties.

664.title: An Act Authorizing Review Of The Department Of Environmental Protection's Guidance Statements And Policies By The General Assembly's Regulation Review Committee.
664.description: To provide the regulated community with an opportunity to have the guidance statements and policies of the Department of Environmental Protection reviewed by the Regulation Review Committee of the General Assembly.

665.title: An Act Concerning Deposit Refunds On Certain Beverage Containers Donated To Charity.
665.description: To avoid any gaps in coverage under a general permit issued by the Commissioner of Environmental Protection.

666.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
666.title: An Act Concerning Fishing Licenses For Disabled Veterans.
666.description: To provide additional disabled veterans with free hunting and fishing licenses.

667.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Planning and Development
667.title: An Act Concerning The Preservation Of Natural Vegetation Near Wetlands And Watercourses And Certain Enhancements To The Inland Wetlands And Watercourses Act.
667.description: To protect natural vegetation in areas near wetlands and watercourses.

668.title: An Act Concerning Long Island Sound, Coastal Permitting And Certain Group Fishing Licenses And Permits For Solid Waste Facilities.
668.description: To assist property owners in complying with certain coastal permitting requirements, streamline certain tidal wetlands procedures and repeal certain obsolete coastal management programs and administrative statutes.

669.title: An Act Concerning Dogs At State Campgrounds.
669.description: To authorize the presence of dogs at camp sites located in state parks.

670.title: An Act Adding Wood Smoke To The Public Health Nuisance Code And Concerning Outdoor Wood-burning Furnaces.
670.description: To add wood smoke to the public health nuisance list and to ban outdoor wood-burning furnaces.

671.title: An Act Concerning The Accounting System For Redeemed Beverage Containers.
671.description: To expand certain solid waste management practices and reporting, including recycling and composting.

672.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
672.title: An Act Concerning Bowling Establishment Alcoholic Liquor Permit Fees.
672.description: To reduce the annual fee for a bowling establishment permit.

673.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
673.title: An Act Establishing An Office Of Condominium Ombudsman.
673.description: To establish an Office of Condominium Ombudsman within the Department of Consumer Protection.

674.title: An Act Concerning Cancelled Doctors' Appointments.
674.description: To protect patients by requiring physicians and medical practices to post notice relating to missed appointment fees.

675.title: An Act Concerning Retainage.
675.description: To limit retainage amounts in commercial construction contracts to five per cent.

676.title: An Act Concerning Landscape Architects.
676.description: To allow landscape architects to form professional practices with architects, professional engineers and land surveyors.

677.title: An Act Concerning Apprentice To Journeymen And Contractor Ratios.
677.description: To change existing apprentice to journeymen and contractor hiring ratios for certain tradespersons.

678.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections
678.title: An Act Concerning The Sale Of The Former Seaside Regional Center Property.
678.description: To expedite the sale of the former Seaside Regional Center property so that the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services may obtain revenue from the sale.

679.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections
679.title: An Act Reducing Grants From The Citizens' Election Program And Transferring The Resulting Savings To The General Fund.
679.description: To reduce the grant amounts in the Citizens' Election Program by fifty per cent and transfer the savings to the General Fund.

680.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
680.title: An Act Establishing A Study Committee To Review The Department Of Higher Education's Process Of Reviewing And Approving Academic Programs.
680.description: To eliminate the requirement that nonprofit independent institutions of higher education obtain approval from the Board of Governors of Higher Education to implement new and revised academic programs.

681.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical Revisions To The Human Services Statutes.
681.description: To make technical revisions to the statutes.

682.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
682.title: An Act Concerning Motions For Summary Judgment In Juvenile Court Matters.
682.description: To allow parties to file motions for summary judgment in juvenile court.

683.title: An Act Concerning Independent Monitoring Of The Husky Program.
683.description: To require the Department of Social Services to contract with a nonprofit organization to provide independent performance monitoring of the HUSKY program.

684.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
684.title: An Act Concerning Youth Transitioning Between The Department Of Children And Families And The Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services.
684.description: To ensure that youth successfully transition between the Department of Children and Families and the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services.

685.title: An Act Requiring Disclosure Of Offsets In Group Long-term Disability Insurance Policies.
685.description: To prohibit the inclusion, in a disability income protection coverage offset, of disability benefits received under the Social Security Act by any dependent child of an insured.

686.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
686.title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Bonds To Construct A Ymca Facility In Ellington.
686.description: To authorize the state to issue bonds for the construction of a YMCA in Ellington.

687.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
687.title: An Act Concerning The Village Green Rehabilitation.
687.description: To permit state funds to be used to rehabilitate housing located in a five-hundred-year floodplain in the Town of Vernon.

688.title: An Act Concerning Enhanced Regionalism.
688.description: To increase regional cooperation and make government more efficient and less expensive.

689.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
689.title: An Act Concerning Intermunicipal Cooperation.
689.description: To increase regional cooperation and make government more efficient and less expensive.

690.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
690.title: An Act Concerning The Collection Of Dna.
690.description: To transfer responsibility for the collection of DNA from sex offenders from the Department of Public Safety to the Court Support Services Division, to expand the offense of refusal to submit to such collection to include failure to submit, to make any failure or refusal to submit to DNA analysis a class D felony, to allow the Division of Scientific Services to approve the type of collection kits used to collect buccal samples and to add the Executive Director of the Court Support Services Division or a designee to the DNA Data Bank Oversight Panel.

691.title: An Act Permitting "fifty-fifty" Coupon Games At Certain Organization Functions And Athletic Events.
691.description: To allow the use of "fifty-fifty" coupon game fundraising at organization functions and athletic events pursuant to a "fifty-fifty" special event permit.

692.title: An Act Concerning The Term "emergency Management Director" And Redefining "major Disaster" And "emergency".
692.description: To redefine "major disaster" to include catastrophes for which the Governor has declared a civil preparedness emergency, to redefine "emergency" to include state-declared emergencies, to add the term "emergency" to the definition of "civil preparedness" and to substitute the term "local emergency management director" for the term "local civil preparedness director".

693.title: An Act Concerning The Governor's Power To Modify Or Suspend Statutes, Regulations Or Other Requirements During A Public Health Emergency.
693.description: To permit the Governor to modify or suspend any statute, regulation or requirement during a public health emergency.

694.title: An Act Concerning Repeated False Alarms.
694.description: To make the violation of the emergency response to repeated false alarms statute an infraction.

695.title: An Act Limiting The Indemnification Of Fire Service Instructors.
695.description: To limit the indemnification of fire service instructors to those instructors who provide such training to their own municipal, regional, state or tribal nation fire department or while employed by the Commission on Fire Prevention and Control.

696.title: An Act Concerning Changes To The General Statutes Concerning The Department Of Children And Families.
696.description: To repeal several obsolete reporting requirements and advisory boards and commissions and make various technical modifications to the general statutes regarding the Department of Children and Families.

697.title: An Act Providing A Safe Harbor For Exploited Children.
697.description: To establish a presumption in prosecution of a person under the age of seventeen for prostitution that such person was a victim of the crime of trafficking in persons.

698.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
698.title: An Act Authorizing A Differential Response By The Department Of Children And Families To Reports Of Child Abuse.
698.description: To authorize the Department of Children and Families to establish a differential response system for action on reports of child abuse and neglect.

699.title: An Act Concerning The Educational Placement Of Children In The Care And Custody Of The Department Of Children And Families.
699.description: To ensure that children in foster care remain in the schools they attended prior to removal from their homes whenever remaining in such schools is in the best interests of the child.

700.title: An Act Concerning The Transfer Of Educational Credits.
700.description: To expand transfer of records provisions to Unified School District #2, operated by the Department of Children and Families.

701.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary
701.title: An Act Exempting The United States Probation Office From The Requirement To Pay For Certified Copies Of Criminal Records.
701.description: To include the United States Probation Office in the list of United States agencies exempt from paying a fee for a certified copy of a criminal record.

702.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
702.title: An Act Concerning The Film Tax Credit.
702.description: To make more state companies eligible for the film tax credit program.

703.title: An Act Concerning Intermunicipal Cooperation And Enhanced Regionalism.
703.description: To provide incentives for intermunicipal cooperation and make government more efficient and less expensive.

704.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
704.title: An Act Establishing A Quasi-public Economic Development Agency.
704.description: To create a single, more efficient and user friendly quasi-public economic development agency.

705.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
705.title: An Act Establishing A State-wide Property Tax.
705.description: To assess a state-wide property tax.

706.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
706.title: An Act Concerning An Increase In The Hotel Tax.
706.description: To capture more revenue, especially from out-of-staters.

707.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Judiciary
707.title: An Act Restoring Funding For Human Rights Referees.
707.description: To provide funding to the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities necessary to restore the human rights referee positions that were eliminated in the last budget.

708.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
708.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Train Shuttles.
708.description: To encourage the use of mass transit by making the MetroNorth trains more user-friendly.

709.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
709.title: An Act To Eliminate The Fee Charged By The Department Of Motor Vehicles For The Issuance Of Special Number Plates For Veterans.
709.description: To honor and recognize those who have served our country, without charging a fee for special number plates.

710.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
710.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From The Business Entity Tax.
710.description: To exempt certain small businesses from the state business entity tax.

711.title: An Act Concerning Indemnification Of Certain Police Officers.
711.description: To allow an indemnified police officer to recover attorney's fees and costs incurred for such indemnification.

712.title: An Act Concerning Workers' Compensation And A Police Officer's Use Of Deadly Force On A Mammal.
712.description: To provide workers' compensation coverage for mental or emotional impairment for a police officer required to use deadly force on an animal that attempts to injure such police officer.

713.title: An Act Requiring Employers To Cite A Reason For Termination Of Their Employees.
713.description: To require that an employer provide a reason, in writing, for terminating an employee.

714.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Public Safety
714.title: An Act Concerning Termination Without Cause For Certain Officers In Municipal Police Departments.
714.description: To provide employment protection for the executive officers of a municipal police department not subject to a collective bargaining agreement.

715.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
715.title: An Act Reestablishing A Licensed Practical Nurse Program.
715.description: To transfer funds from the General Fund to the Department of Education for the administration of licensed practical nursing programs at the regional vocational-technical schools.

716.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
716.title: An Act Mandating Home Health Agencies Provide Paid Sick Leave To Employees.
716.description: To provide a property tax freeze for residents eighty-five years of age and older.

717.title: An Act Concerning Action Plans For The Department Of Economic And Community Development.
717.description: To require that the Commissioner of the Department of Economic and Community Development present an annual report containing immediate priorities for the strategic long-term growth of Connecticut.

718.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
718.title: An Act Concerning The Standards Of Water Quality.
718.description: To require that all proposed changes to water quality standards undergo the rulemaking procedures and notice and comment requirements set forth in chapter 54 of the Connecticut general statutes.

719.title: An Act Triggering Certain Economic Development Programs And Extending The Deadline For Certain Tax Exemptions.
719.description: To establish the Connecticut Competitiveness Council.

721.title: An Act Concerning Vending Machine Sales.
721.description: To exempt candy and carbonated beverages sold at vending machines from the sales tax.

722.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Energy and Technology
722.title: An Act Concerning Economic Indicators In Energy Decisions.
722.description: To encourage the consideration of the impact of certain energy investments on the state's economy.

723.title: An Act Requiring Continual 9-1-1 Service.
723.description: To ensure that customers whose telephone service is terminated for nonpayment still have access to emergency services.

724.last_action: Removed from the Foot of the Calendar, Senate
724.title: An Act Eliminating The Sunset For The Residential Energy Conservation Service Program.
724.description: To ensure the continuation of the residential energy conservation service program.

725.last_action: Removed from the Foot of the Calendar, Senate
725.title: An Act Concerning Renewable Energy Sources.
725.description: To include energy produced from upgrades at existing hydropower plants in the definition of Class I renewable energy sources.

726.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
726.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Utility Statutes.
726.description: To modify the Department of Public Utility Control's regulation of utilities and other entities.

727.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
727.title: An Act Concerning Retail Wine Sellers And Wine-related Classes.
727.description: To allow package store liquor permit holders to conduct fee-based wine tastings and classes on their premises.

728.title: An Act Concerning Surcharges On Retail Fuel Oil And Propane Deliveries.
728.description: To protect retail fuel oil and propane consumers.

729.title: An Act Concerning Advertising By Nonlicensed Tradespersons.
729.description: To provide penalties for persons who wilfully and falsely advertise to perform work for which certain trade licenses are required.

730.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
730.title: An Act Concerning Automatic External Defibrillators In Health Clubs.
730.description: To establish requirements regarding the placement, maintenance and use of automatic external defibrillators in health clubs.

731.title: An Act Increasing Penalties For Violations Of The No Sales Solicitation Calls Act.
731.description: To standardize the penalties for wilful violations of the state no sales solicitation call statute and the federal do not call registry.

732.title: An Act Establishing Uniform Procedures Regarding New Home Construction Contractor And Home Improvement Contractor And Salesman-related Complaints.
732.description: To establish uniform Department of Consumer Protection new home construction contractor and home improvement contractor and salesman related complaint procedures.

733.title: An Act Establishing An Advisory Council On Services For Persons With Traumatic Brain Injury.
733.description: To establish an advisory commission to address the needs of persons with traumatic brain injury.

734.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
734.title: An Act Concerning A Four-hour Accident Prevention Course For Older Drivers.
734.description: To provide for a four-hour accident prevention course for older drivers.

735.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
735.title: An Act Concerning Motor Carrier Indemnity Agreements.
735.description: To prohibit motor carrier transportation contracts from including any provision that requires a motor carrier to indemnify another party for loss or damage that arises from that party's own negligence or intentional acts or omissions.

736.title: An Act Concerning The Listing Of Advanced Practice Registered Nurses In Managed Care Organization Provider Listings, And Primary Care Provider Designations.
736.description: To allow an insured or certificate holder to designate a participating, in-network physician or advanced practice registered nurse as such insured's or certificate holder's primary care provider.

737.title: An Act Concerning Liability Insurance For Boats.
737.description: To require general liability insurance for vessels registering with the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles.

738.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
738.title: An Act Concerning Rate Approvals For Certain Health Insurance Policies.
738.description: To establish procedures for a hearing prior to any rate approval for individual health insurance policies, to authorize the Healthcare Advocate or the Attorney General or both to be a party to any such hearing and to specify the amount of time the Insurance Department is required to retain certain records.

739.title: An Act Concerning The Designation Of Regional Fire Schools.
739.description: To require that the Commission on Fire Prevention and Control, in consultation with the Connecticut State Firefighter's Association, approve the establishment of any regional fire school, to give the commission the authority to revoke any such approval, to provide that the commission may disburse funds to the regional fire schools, and to require the regional fire schools to submit an audited report concerning the use of such funds.

740.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
740.title: An Act Concerning The Collection Of Delinquent Taxes And Lottery Winnings.
740.description: To require the Connecticut Lottery Corporation to compare the name of any winner of a lottery prize of five thousand dollars or more against a list of delinquent taxpayers compiled by the Department of Revenue Services, and, if the lottery winner is on said list, to deduct the amount of delinquent taxes and any other applicable penalties or interest from the lottery winnings.

741.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Education
741.title: An Act Concerning In-school Suspensions.
741.description: To delay the implementation of a mandate on municipalities and school districts.

742.title: An Act Requiring A Two-thirds Vote To Enact New Municipal Mandates.
742.description: To require a two-thirds vote of the General Assembly to enact legislation that creates or enlarges a state mandate to local governments.

743.title: An Act Concerning The State Plan Of Conservation And Development And Dissolving The Wolcottville School Society.
743.description: To revise the statutes concerning the state plan of conservation and development.

744.title: An Act Concerning Technical And Conforming Changes To Certain Property Tax Relief And Municipal Grant Programs.
744.description: To (1) make technical corrections regarding the Local Capital Improvement Program statutes; (2) modify requirements concerning the process by which elderly and totally disabled renters apply for a grant in refund of utility and rent bills so as to reflect the use of an automated application system consistent with current practice; and (3) make a technical correction regarding an incorrect reference in the statute governing claimant appeals for tax relief and renters' rebate programs.

745.title: An Act Making Technical Revisions To The Planning And Development Statutes, Delaying Revaluation For Certain Municipalities, Making Substantive Changes To Statutes Concerning Housing Blight And Authorizing The Modification Of Certain Electricity Purchase Agreements.
745.description: To make technical revisions to the planning and development statutes.

746.title: An Act Eliminating A Requirement That Members Of The Board Of Tax Review In The Town Of Beacon Falls Be Elected.
746.description: To eliminate a provision in a special act requiring the election of members of the board of tax review in the town of Beacon Falls.

747.title: An Act Permitting Condominium Associations To Benefit From Clean Energy Fund Programs.
747.description: To make Connecticut Clean Energy Fund Programs accessible to condominium associations.

748.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Sale Of Alcoholic Liquor On Sunday.
748.description: To implement the recommendations of the Program Review and Investigations Committee to allow for the sale of alcoholic liquor on Sunday.

749.title: An Act Concerning Enhancements To The Inland Wetlands And Watercourses Act.
749.description: To augment the scope of the evidence considered by inland wetlands agencies when determining whether to grant a permit.

750.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Planning and Development
750.title: An Act Concerning Local Land Use Agencies And The Siting Of Telecommunication Towers.
750.description: To provide local land use agencies with the authority to regulate the siting of telecommunication towers.

751.title: An Act Authorizing The Hunting Of Deer By Revolver And Establishing Certain Credits Toward The Purchase Of Hunting And Fishing Licenses.
751.description: To reduce the recent increase in hunting and fishing fees to a twenty per cent increase, increase the fine for failure to wear a seat belt, increase the fine for certain motor vehicle infractions and create a new limited operator's permit that allows people who have been convicted of driving under the influence to drive to work and to school.

752.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
752.title: An Act Concerning Refunds For Taxes Erroneously Collected From Veterans.
752.description: To eliminate the statute of limitations for the recovery of taxes erroneously collected from veterans.

754.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
754.title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Exemptions For One Hundred Per Cent Disabled Veterans.
754.description: To exempt from property taxes the primary residence of veterans with a one hundred per cent disability rating.

755.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
755.title: An Act Concerning Criminal Cases Of Persons Who Have Returned From Service With The Armed Forces.
755.description: To establish a separate criminal docket for hearing criminal matters and providing diversionary services for defendants who have returned from service with the armed services, similar to the criminal docket for matters in which a defendant is a drug-dependent person.

756.title: An Act Clarifying That The Motor Vehicle Tax Exemption For Members Of The Armed Forces Applies To Vehicles Jointly Owned With A Spouse.
756.description: To clarify that the existing motor vehicle tax exemption for members of the armed forces applies to vehicles that are jointly owned with a spouse.

757.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Transportation
757.title: An Act Concerning Compliance With The Military Selective Service Act.
757.description: To require the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles to electronically transmit to the Selective Service System the information of driver's license and identity card applicants who are required to register with the Selective Service System pursuant to federal law.

758.title: An Act Naming The State Military Training Facility Camp Niantic.
758.description: To permanently name the state military training facility Camp Niantic instead of changing the name each time a new Governor is elected.

760.title: An Act Concerning Employment Of Private Detectives By Municipalities.
760.description: To update and clarify existing law regarding municipal employment of private detectives.

761.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Banks
761.title: An Act Limiting Financial Institution Fees For Records Needed For Medicaid Applications.
761.description: To limit the fees that financial institutions may require for records of account needed by the Commissioner of Social Services to determine eligibility for Medicaid.

762.title: An Act Concerning Safe Haven Cases And The Termination Of Rental Agreements By Victims Of Family Violence.
762.description: To clarify the Department of Children and Families' role and responsibility in safe haven cases and to specify a safe haven procedure when the mother is in the hospital.

763.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
763.title: An Act Concerning State Contract Reductions.
763.description: To allow private service providers to adjust their budget expenditures without approval when a state agency reduces the providers' funding.

764.title: An Act Concerning The Elimination Of Certain Department Of Social Services Reporting Requirements.
764.description: To eliminate certain Department of Social Services reporting requirements.

765.title: An Act Prohibiting The Disclosure Of Employee Files To Inmates.
765.description: To prohibit the disclosure of personnel, medical and similar files concerning current or former employees of the Department of Correction or the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services to inmates and other persons in the custody of, or under the supervision of, the Commissioner of Correction or confined in a facility of the Whiting Forensic Division.

766.title: An Act Concerning Complaints Pending In The Department Of Public Health Against Physicians And Certain Other Health Care Providers And Establishing A Mediation Program For Medical Malpractice Actions.
766.description: To (1) permit a person who files a complaint with the Department of Public Health alleging incompetence, negligence, fraud or deceit by a health care provider to obtain information about the status of the complaint, notice of any scheduled hearing or proposed consent order with respect to the complaint, and notice of the final disposition of the complaint, and (2) establish a mediation program for medical malpractice actions.

767.title: An Act Requiring Noncustodial Parents To Provide Emergency Contact Information.
767.description: To require a noncustodial parent to provide emergency contact information to the custodial parent, or to the Department of Children and Families when appropriate, unless exempted by the court, in the event of an emergency with respect to the parents' child.

768.title: An Act Concerning Eligibility For Youthful Offender Status.
768.description: To limit eligibility for youthful offender status to youths who have not been previously adjudged youthful offenders.

769.title: An Act Concerning The Duties Of A Mortgagee In A Foreclosure Action On Residential Real Property.
769.description: To require mortgage lenders who seek to foreclose on residential real property to provide notice to the defendant that identifies the individual who has authority to refinance the mortgage, and to permit the court to deny or delay entry of a mortgage lender's motion to foreclose or motion for a deficiency judgment when the court finds that the mortgage lender did not provide such notice or act reasonably, provided the court finds that fairness and equity requires such result.

770.title: An Act Concerning Zoning Enforcement Officers.
770.description: To eliminate a provision allowing treble damages against a zoning enforcement officer who issues a citation if a court finds that such citation was issued frivolously or without probable cause.

771.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Environment
771.title: An Act Concerning The Unauthorized Use Of All-terrain Vehicles And Snowmobiles.
771.description: To increase the penalty for the unauthorized use of an all-terrain vehicle or snowmobile on state, municipal and private property.

772.title: An Act Concerning Appraisal Reform.
772.description: To require real estate appraisers to be licensed in accordance with the provisions of chapter 400g of the general statutes before they are allowed to charge a fee for performing appraisals and to ensure transparency with regard to the fees charged by such appraisers.

773.title: An Act Concerning The Pretrial Supervised Diversionary Program For Persons With Psychiatric Disabilities.
773.description: To (1) clarify procedures for admission to, and treatment in, the pretrial supervised diversionary program for persons with psychiatric disabilities, and (2) limit participation in such program to two years.

774.title: An Act Concerning The Videotaping Of Custodial Interrogations.
774.description: To improve the reliability of confessions by providing that statements made by a person during custodial interrogation at a place of detention are presumed inadmissible unless the custodial interrogation is electronically recorded.

775.title: An Act Creating An Amnesty Program For Delinquent Lottery Sales Agents.
775.description: To allow the executive director of the Division of Special Revenue to negotiate settlements with delinquent lottery sales agents.

776.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of A Certificate, Professional Designation Or Advertising In Advising Senior Citizens.
776.description: To protect seniors from deceptive practices of financial advisers.

777.title: An Act Concerning The Discharge Of Patients For Nonpayment Of Applied Income.
777.description: To allow nursing home facilities to transfer or discharge patients who fail to pay applied income to the facility for more than sixty days.

778.title: An Act Concerning Notification Of Financial Stability Of Nursing Home Facilities And Managed Residential Communities To Patients And Residents.
778.description: To provide consumers with full disclosure of the current financial status of the nursing home facility or managed residential community so that consumers can make an informed decision about admission.

779.title: An Act Reducing The Interest Rate On Security Deposits.
779.description: To eliminate the unfair burden placed on landlords who must pay a tenant a higher interest rate on a security deposit than the landlord may obtain from depositing such funds in a bank.

780.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
780.title: An Act Establishing A Connecticut Safe Harbor Fund.
780.description: To allow community banks to maintain a working relationship with their borrowers and continue to serve the communities they occupy.

781.title: An Act Concerning The Statute Of Limitations For Crimes Associated With Homicide.
781.description: To provide that there shall be no limitation of time within which a person may be prosecuted for an offense committed with the intent to prevent detection of a person responsible for a homicide.

782.title: An Act Concerning A Specialized Docket For Land Use Appeals.
782.description: To establish a specialized land use appeal docket in each judicial district.

783.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
783.title: An Act Concerning The Continuation Of Day Care Subsidies To Unemployed Workers.
783.description: To allow individuals who are eligible to receive unemployment compensation benefits to continue to receive child care subsidy benefits after losing their job so they are able to look for a new employment position.

784.title: An Act Concerning The E-verify Program.
784.description: To require certain employers to use the free federal E-Verify program.

785.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Administrative Services And Prequalification And Evaluation Of Contractors.
785.description: To modify the contractor prequalification statutes so the Department of Administrative Services may more effectively identify contractors with past unsatisfactory contract performances.

786.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
786.title: An Act Concerning The Retention Of Jobs In Connecticut.
786.description: To help keep jobs in Connecticut and stem the economic damage caused by outsourcing.

787.title: An Act Concerning Unemployment Benefits For Those Persons Who Become Disabled While Unemployed.
787.description: To maintain unemployment benefits to individuals who become injured while collecting said benefits.

788.title: An Act Concerning The Cornfield Point Association And Validating The November 3, 2009, Referendum In The Town Of Columbia Regarding Revisions To The Charter Of The Town Of Columbia.
788.description: To validate the charter revision referendum held on November 3, 2009, in the town of Columbia.

789.title: An Act Concerning Smoking In Workplaces.
789.description: To extend the smoking prohibition to workplaces with one or more employees.

790.title: An Act Concerning Issuance Of Emergency Certificates And The Safety Of Patients And Staff At Facilities Operated By The Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services.
