790.description: To: (1) Allow certain licensed clinical social workers and advanced practice registered nurses who have completed specialized training in conducting direct evaluations through community support programs certified by Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to issue emergency certificates, and (2) ensure the safety and well-being of patients and staff at facilities operated by the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services.

791.title: An Act Concerning Technical Changes To Statutes Pertaining To The Department Of Mental Health And Addiction Services.
791.description: To revise the statutes to accurately reflect current practices of the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services and the Connecticut Valley Hospital Advisory Council.

792.title: An Act Concerning The Reporting Of Adverse Events At Hospitals And Outpatient Surgical Facilities And Access To Information Related To Pending Complaints Filed With The Department Of Public Health.
792.description: To (1) require that the Department of Public Health's annual report to the General Assembly on adverse events include information that identifies the hospitals or outpatient surgical facilities where such adverse events occurred, (2) require the Department of Public Health to conduct annual random audits of hospitals and outpatient surgical facilities concerning adverse events and thereafter include information on such audits in its annual adverse events report, (3) provide employment protections to certain individuals who take action in furtherance of the adverse event reporting objectives, (4) provide the Commissioner of Public Health with authority to impose civil penalties against hospitals and outpatient surgical facilities, and (5) require that hospitals report annually on the rate of health care associated infections.

793.last_action: Vote to Hold Until Next Meeting
793.title: An Act Concerning Use Of The Term "assisted Living".
793.description: To protect consumers by ensuring that entities are not allowed to use the term "assisted living" in communications to the public unless the assisted living services are provided by licensed personnel.

794.title: An Act Concerning Anatomical Gifts.
794.description: To adopt the Revised Uniform Anatomical Gift Act.

795.title: An Act Concerning The Long-term Care Advisory Council.
795.description: To add a member to the Long-Term Care Advisory Council and to make technical changes to the statute establishing the council.

796.title: An Act Concerning Medical Malpractice Data Reporting.
796.description: To add clarifying definitions, to expand professional liability insurance closed claim reporting requirements, to grant the Insurance Commissioner the authority to fine entities that fail to submit reports as required and to add confidentiality provisions.

797.title: An Act Concerning Notice Of Termination Of Individual Term Life Insurance Policies For Nonpayment Of Premium.
797.description: To require a notice of cancellation or discontinuation of life insurance policies to be sent by registered or certified mail or by a method that provides proof of delivery of such notice.

798.title: An Act Concerning Disclosure Of Maximum Allowable Costs For Pharmacy Reimbursements.
798.description: To require pharmacy benefit managers to disclose to health benefit plans such managers administer, the maximum allowable costs to be paid for generic prescription drugs under such plans.

799.title: An Act Prohibiting Differential Payment Rates To Health Care Providers For Colonoscopy Or Endoscopic Services Based On Site Of Service.
799.description: To prohibit the use of differential payment rates based on site of service for a physician's professional services component of colonoscopy or endoscopic services.

800.title: An Act Concerning Assessments For Health Benefit Reviews Performed By The Insurance Department.
800.description: To specify that assessments by the Insurance Department for the purpose of carrying out the health benefit reviews be made against domestic insurance companies and other domestic entities authorized to write health insurance in the state.

801.title: An Act Concerning Medical Payments Coverage For Automobile Insurance Policies.
801.description: To require automobile liability insurance policies to include medical payments coverage.

802.title: An Act Concerning Disclosure Of Documents And Information Considered By A Utilization Review Company In A Final Determination.
802.description: To specify a presumption of medical necessity for appeals reviewed by review entities on behalf of the Insurance Commissioner pursuant to section 38a-478n of the general statutes, to require managed care companies, health insurers and utilization review companies to provide to providers of record and enrollees after a final determination not to certify an admission, service, procedure or extension of stay, documents and information considered in such final determination, and to require dispensation and coverage of a prescribed drug for the duration of any appeal of a determination not to certify such dispensation.

803.title: An Act Concerning Insurance Coverage For Mammograms.
803.description: To require insurance coverage of breast MRIs and additional mammograms in a policy year if an annual mammogram demonstrates heterogeneous or dense breast tissue or if a woman is believed to be at increased risk for breast cancer due to family history or prior personal history of breast cancer, positive genetic testing or other indications as determined by a woman's physician or advanced practice registered nurse.

804.title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For Routine Patient Care Costs For Certain Clinical Trial Patients.
804.description: To require individual and group health insurance coverage of routine patient costs associated with clinical trials for the treatment of serious or life-threatening diseases.

805.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Job Corps Task Force.
805.description: To encourage unemployed individuals to make contributions to the community during periods of unemployment.

806.title: An Act Concerning Collaborative Drug Therapy Management Agreements.
806.description: To expand upon the opportunities for licensed pharmacists to engage in collaborative drug therapy management agreements with licensed physicians.

807.title: An Act Requiring Tanning Facilities To Provide Notification Of The Health Risks Associated With The Use Of Tanning Devices.
807.description: To require tanning facilities to inform consumers of the health risks associated with the use of a tanning device prior to the use of such devices.

808.title: An Act Prohibiting Smoking In Licensed Child Care Facilities.
808.description: To protect children in licensed child care facilities from the dangers of second hand smoke.

809.title: An Act Requiring Health Care Providers To Display Photographic Identification Badges.
809.description: To require health care providers who provide direct patient care to wear photographic identification badges during the course of normal working hours.

810.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
810.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Transferring Adult Education Programs To The Community-technical College System.
810.description: To implement the recommendations of the Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning an examination of the feasibility of transferring the adult education programs to the Community-Technical College System.

811.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Role And Purpose Of The Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority.
811.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning the role and purpose of the Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority.

812.last_action: Vote to Hold Until Next Meeting
812.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Establishing A Pilot Program To Reward Institutions Of Higher Education That Are Meeting Established Goals.
812.description: To implement the recommendations of the Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning establishing a pilot program that monetarily rewards the constituent units for meeting established goals.

813.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning An Initiative To Share Agency Data To Promote The Well-being Of Children And Families.
813.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning an initiative to share agency data to promote the well-being of children and families.

814.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
814.title: An Act Concerning The Prohibition Of Certain Gifts From Pharmaceutical And Medical Device Manufacturing Companies To Health Care Providers.
814.description: To adopt in this state the recently enacted Massachusetts standards concerning restrictions on gifts and payments from pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturing companies to health care providers.

815.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
815.title: An Act Concerning The Treasurer's Trust Preferred Security Purchase Program.
815.description: To expand a bank's ability to raise capital and ensure the continuous delivery of lending products to such bank's communities by enhancing the ability of the trust funds to purchase long-term Connecticut trust preferred securities issued by the bank.

816.title: An Act Concerning Drunk Boating And Certain Vessels Registered With Marine Dealer Registration Numbers.
816.description: To extend the period of time that a blood alcohol test for boating under the influence may be administered if expert testimony establishes the reliability of such test.

817.title: An Act Concerning The Discharge Of Certain Vessel Pressure Washing Wastewaters.
817.description: To allow marinas to engage in the pressure washing of vessel bottoms if the wastewater does not contain biocide compounds.

818.title: An Act Prohibiting The Unreasonable Confinement And Tethering Of Dogs.
818.description: To define what it means to unreasonably confine or tether a dog.

820.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
820.title: An Act Concerning Petitions For Neglected, Uncared-for Or Dependent Child Or Youth.
820.description: To include "any superintendent of schools" to the list of persons who may file a petition for neglected, uncared-for or dependent child or youth with the Superior Court.

821.title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of Students On Local And Regional Boards Of Education.
821.description: To allow students to voice their concerns and share their opinions on matters affecting their education by serving as nonvoting members on their local or regional board of education.

822.title: An Act Concerning Truancy.
822.description: To require school districts making a referral to the court because of truancy problems to file such referral not later than fifteen days after a parent or person having control of a child who is truant fails to attend a meeting to discuss such truancy or otherwise fails to cooperate with the school attempting to solve such truancy problem; to require the State Board of Education to define "excused absence" and "unexcused absence" for uniformity in data collection and analysis in school district truancy problems; and to require the State Board of Education to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on truancy data and school district truancy programs.

823.title: An Act Concerning Foreign Languages Taught In The Public Schools.
823.description: To require high school students to complete a minimum of two years of world language study prior to graduation.

824.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
824.title: An Act Increasing The Fines For Violation Of School Bus Regulations.
824.description: To allow regional educational service centers to provide school transportation services to students only when there are no other responsible qualified bidders and to allow a parent or guardian of a student to submit a written waiver of school transportation services to the local or regional board of education.

825.title: An Act Concerning Public Participation In Meetings Of The Pharmaceutical And Therapeutics Committee.
825.description: To allow members of the public to participate in meetings of the pharmaceutical and therapeutics committee.

826.title: An Act Concerning Implementation Of An Attendance-based Rate System By The Department Of Developmental Services.
826.description: To prohibit the Department of Developmental Services from implementing an attendance-based reimbursement system until the advisory committee for reimbursements for services under programs administered by the Department of Developmental Services completes its work.

827.title: An Act Concerning Audits By The Department Of Social Services.
827.description: To change the procedure for audits conducted by the Department of Social Services and to provide a right of appeal.

828.title: An Act Creating A Division Of Administrative Hearings.
828.description: To establish a Division of Administrative Hearings within the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities to hear contested cases concerning the Departments of Children and Families, Transportation and Motor Vehicles, the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities and the Board of Firearms Permit Examiners.

829.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
829.title: An Act Requiring Public Bidding For Judicial Department Public Building Contracts.
829.description: To create parity between the dollar threshold for consultants on the "On-Call List" for nonhigher education projects and on the "On-Call List" for higher education projects and to reflect the current rate of inflation in the industry and to clarify that the Judicial Department is required to use competitive bidding for every contract for construction, reconstruction and alteration of a public building or other public work which is estimated to cost more than $500,000.

830.title: An Act Concerning The Duties Of The Department Of Information Technology.
830.description: To allow the Department of Information Technology to establish general guidelines for the professional development of state information technology employees rather than training other agency employees, to allow the department to establish general guidelines concerning the fees for copying computer-stored public records rather than monitoring individual agency fees, to add the department to the list of departments within the executive branch and to add the department as a member to the E 9-1-1 Commission.

831.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
831.title: An Act Concerning Accessible Voting For Voters With Disabilities Or Needing Assistance.
831.description: To provide that each polling place comply with requirements for assisting electors with disabilities to vote and to prohibit a candidate who is on the ballot from accompanying an elector needing assistance into a voting booth and assisting the elector in voting.

832.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical Corrections To The General Government Administration And Elections Statutes.
832.description: To make technical and grammatical corrections to the general government administration and elections statutes.

833.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
833.title: An Act Concerning The Online Submission And Posting Of Statements Of Financial Interests.
833.description: To require that statements of financial interests be filed electronically and to make such statements available to the public through the online posting of such statements.

834.title: An Act Concerning The Publication Of State Agency Regulations On The Internet.
834.description: To require state agency regulations to be posted on the Internet web site of the state agency adopting such regulations.

835.title: An Act Concerning The Appointment Of Department Heads.
835.description: To require the advice and consent of both houses of the General Assembly for the appointment of department heads.

836.title: An Act Concerning Homeless Youth.
836.description: To authorize the Commissioner of Children and Families to administer, within available appropriations, a program of outreach, shelter and transitional living services for homeless youth.

837.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
837.title: An Act Providing Certain Adult Adopted Persons With Access To Parental Health Information And Information In Their Original Birth Certificates.
837.description: To provide each adult adopted person with access to parental health information and information in the person's original birth certificate.

838.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
838.title: An Act Concerning Documentation Of Reasonable Efforts To Reunite A Parent With A Child And To Locate Relatives.
838.description: To document efforts made by the Commissioner of Children and Families to reunite parents with children, locate relatives and provide long-term foster care placement.

839.title: An Act Requiring A Results-based Accountability Report Card Of Out-of-state Residential Treatment Of Juveniles.
839.description: To require the Commissioner of Children and Families to study residential placement.

840.title: An Act Concerning Visitation Between A Parent And A Child In Cases Involving The Department Of Children And Families.
840.description: To provide visitation rights to a parent when reunification is part of a permanency plan and to authorize suspension only after a hearing, except in an emergency.

841.title: An Act Concerning Preschool Standards.
841.description: To assure that guidelines for preschool curriculum content provide children with the skills and knowledge to enter school.

842.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
842.title: An Act Requiring A Factual Basis For Acceptance Of A Plea In Certain Juvenile Matters.
842.description: To require the court to find a factual basis for accepting a plea regarding the truth of allegations in certain juvenile matters.

843.title: An Act Concerning A Parent's Obligation To Make Reimbursement To The Department Of Children And Families.
843.description: To relieve parents of the burden of reimbursing the state for the care and custody of children removed from the home if the commissioner determines the income level of the family is three hundred per cent below the poverty level and reimbursement will harm the family.

844.title: An Act Concerning Family And Medical Leave Benefits For Certain Municipal Employees.
844.description: To grant certain ineligible municipal paraprofessionals the right to family and medical leave.

845.title: An Act Concerning The Small Town Economic Assistance Program.
845.description: To encourage regional cooperation by making small town economic assistance grants available to groups of municipalities.

846.title: An Act Concerning State Funding Of Affordable Housing Located In A Five-hundred-year Flood Plain.
846.description: To allow state funding for demolition, redevelopment and new construction of affordable housing located at or below the five-hundred-year flood elevation.

847.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
847.title: An Act Returning A Portion Of The Hotel Sales Tax To Municipalities.
847.description: To allow municipalities the option of adopting a hotel tax ordinance.

848.title: An Act Concerning State Surplus Properties.
848.description: To exempt the Department of Economic and Community Development from certain notice and public comment requirements when the department is transferring ten acres or less of state land.

849.title: An Act Establishing An Optional Municipal Property Tax Relief Program For Property Owners Who Preserve And Maintain Stone Walls.
849.description: To protect the character of municipalities in the state by providing for the preservation of stone walls.

850.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Whistleblowers.
850.description: To implement the recommendations of the Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning whistleblowers, including to add a policy statement, to require the Attorney General and Auditors of Public Accounts to enter into a memorandum of understanding to handle complaints jointly, to allow them to reject complaints in certain circumstances and to refer complaints to other agencies, to require them to monitor the outcome of the complaint and to permit the complainant to be informed of the outcome.

851.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
851.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Angel Investors And Programs Implemented By Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated.
851.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review Committee concerning angel investors.

852.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning Connecticut's Economic Competitiveness.
852.description: To consolidate the functions and duties of the Connecticut Development Authority and Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated.

853.title: An Act Concerning Residential Elevator Safety.
853.description: To require elevators located in private residences to be inspected at the time of installation and time of sale of such residence, and to require that the residential condition report given to a prospective buyer contain information concerning such inspection.

854.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical Corrections To The Public Safety Statutes And An Effective Date Change.
854.description: To make various technical and grammatical corrections to the public safety statutes.

855.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
855.title: An Act Concerning Constables And The Connecticut State Police Resident Trooper Program.
855.description: To clarify that in the event of a conflict between a certain manual of the Department of Public Safety and a collective bargaining agreement that a constable is party to, such collective bargaining agreement shall take precedence.

856.title: An Act Mandating The Regionalization Of Certain Public Safety Emergency Telecommunications Centers And A Study Of Consolidation.
856.description: To provide funding to those municipalities who have formed a regional emergency telecommunications center.

857.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
857.title: An Act Concerning The Acceptability Of Certain Claims For The Veterans' Property Tax Exemption.
857.description: To allow honorably discharged veterans over the age of seventy, who have had their discharge papers destroyed by fire or other natural disaster, qualify for the veterans' property tax exemption by submitting a notarized statement attesting to their veteran status and the loss of their papers due to fire or other natural disaster.

858.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
858.title: An Act Concerning Military Or Veteran Status On State-issued Forms And Publications, Benefits For Veterans And State Employees Called To Active Service And The Disposition Of Remains Of Members Of The Armed Forces.
858.description: To require state agencies, departments and offices to include a question on any new forms or publications sent to the public asking if the recipient is a member of the armed forces or a veteran who would like information regarding veterans' benefits. A state agency, department or office that received a form or publication indicating that the sender is a member of the armed forces or a veteran who would like information regarding veterans' benefits would forward the individual's contact information to the Department of Veterans' Affairs to be added to the department's contact list.

859.title: An Act Concerning The Sexual Assault Of Persons Whose Ability To Communicate Lack Of Consent Is Substantially Impaired.
859.description: To provide that sexual intercourse or sexual contact with a person whose ability to resist or consent is substantially impaired because of a mental or physical condition or advanced age constitutes the crime of sexual assault.

860.title: An Act Establishing A Commission On Nonprofit Health And Human Services.
860.description: To establish a commission to examine the adequacy of funding provided to nonprofit providers of health and human services under purchase of service contracts.

861.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Planning and Development
861.title: An Act Concerning Buildings Located Within The Five-hundred-year Floodplain.
861.description: To authorize state funding to be used to rehabilitate existing affordable housing that is part of the state housing loan portfolio and located within the five-hundred-year flood elevation.

862.title: An Act Concerning Changes To Certain Housing Statutes.
862.description: To (1) authorize housing partnerships to receive resident services coordinators grants and congregate housing subsidies and to be an eligible developer under the congregate housing for the elderly program; (2) clarify the information to be included in the disability registry database; (3) allow for-profit developers to be eligible for the low and moderate income housing predevelopment cost revolving loan fund and interest-free loans for predevelopment costs; (4) allow third-party contractors to receive funding under the Housing Trust Fund program and allow the fund to accept and hold both federal and other public funds in its program account; (5) repeal the requirement for regulations for the Housing Sustainability Fund; and (6) make other technical and conforming changes.

863.title: An Act Concerning An Urban Homesteading Pilot Program.
863.description: To require urban homesteaders to agree to reside in or own urban homesteading property for a period of five years, to expand the definition of urban homesteading agency to include nonprofit entities authorized by their certificate of incorporation to engage in the development of affordable housing, and to make tax credits available to certain lenders that finance the purchase or rehabilitation of certain urban homestead program properties.

864.title: An Act Concerning The Selection Of Tenant Commissioners.
864.description: To provide for greater tenant participation in the selection of tenant commissioners of housing authorities.

865.title: An Act Concerning The State's Consolidated Plan For Housing And Community Development.
865.description: To repeal section 8-37t of the general statutes and to replace all references to the long-range state housing plan with references to the state's consolidated plan for housing and community development.

866.title: An Act Concerning Long-term Care Policies Under The Connecticut Partnership For Long-term Care.
866.description: To protect purchasers of precertified long-term care insurance policies through the Connecticut Partnership for Long-Term Care against substantial increases in premium rates.

867.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
867.title: An Act Concerning Angel Investors And Programs Implemented By Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated.
867.description: To provide tax credits to angel investors and modify the allocation of funds by Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated.

868.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Energy and Technology
868.title: An Act Concerning Energy And The State's Economy.
868.description: To allow energy consumers to take more control of their energy costs, to bolster the vitality of in-state technologies, and to preserve and create jobs.

869.title: An Act Repealing Certain Statutes Related To The Department Of Economic And Community Development.
869.description: To repeal obsolete and redundant sections of the Department of Economic and Community Development statutes.

870.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
870.title: An Act Concerning Local Tax Abatements.
870.description: To allow municipalities to grant abatements greater than currently provided under state law.

871.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
871.title: An Act Concerning Consolidation Of Economic Development Entities.
871.description: To consolidate the functions and duties of the Connecticut Development Authority and Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated.

872.title: An Act Concerning Notaries Public.
872.description: To require the Secretary of the State to review the Model Notary Act of 2010 and update the notary public manual, if the Secretary determines an update is necessary.

873.title: An Act Concerning Student Tuition At Public Institutions Of Higher Education.
873.description: To ensure that the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to higher education has an opportunity to comment on any proposed decreases, increases or maintenance of tuition at public institutions of higher education prior to a vote by the board of trustees on such proposals.

874.title: An Act Concerning Student Employees, The State Ethics Code And Workforce Competitiveness.
874.description: To ensure that student employees at public institutions of higher education do not leave Connecticut to work outside this state because they are classified as state employees and subject to the post-state employment rules set forth in the Code of Ethics for Public Officials, section 1-79, et seq., of the general statutes.

875.title: An Act Providing Local Jurisdiction For Victims Of Tortious Conduct.
875.description: To allow residents of this state to bring civil actions in Connecticut courts for tortious violations of the law of nations or a treaty of the United States.

876.title: An Act Concerning Choice Of Law With Respect To Commercial Transactions.
876.description: To permit the parties to any commercial transaction to agree that Connecticut law will govern their rights and duties, whether or not the transaction bears a reasonable relation to this state.

877.title: An Act Concerning The Validation Of Certain Marriages And Civil Unions.
877.description: To validate the celebration of certain marriages and civil unions otherwise valid except for the fact that the justice of the peace did not have a valid certificate at that time or that the license was issued in the wrong town.

878.title: An Act Concerning The Resolution Of Claims Involving Workers' Compensation Claims.
878.description: To revise the amount of reimbursement received by an employer that has paid workers' compensation benefits to an injured employee when the employee brings an action against a third-party tortfeasor and recovers damages.

879.title: An Act Concerning Justices Of The Peace.
879.description: To authorize a justice of the peace from another state to perform a marriage ceremony in this state if justices of the peace from this state may perform a marriage ceremony in that other state.

880.title: An Act Concerning Negligent Homicide With A Motor Vehicle.
880.description: To increase the penalty for negligent homicide with a motor vehicle from an unclassified misdemeanor to an unclassified felony.

881.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
881.title: An Act Establishing A Municipal Postemployment Benefit Plan Deficit Funding Bonds Pilot Program.
881.description: To authorize municipalities to issue municipal postemployment benefit funding bonds.

882.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
882.title: An Act Concerning The Processing Of Department Of Environmental Protection Permits.
882.description: To expedite the process for issuing certificates of occupancy.

883.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
883.title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Collect The Marijuana And Controlled Substances Tax.
883.description: To authorize municipalities to collect and retain taxes due under the marijuana and controlled substances tax.

884.title: An Act Concerning Public Service License Endorsements, Activity Vehicles, And The Definitions Of "carrier" And "student Transportation Vehicle".
884.description: To repeal the term "activity vehicle" and to amend the definitions of "carrier" and "student transportation vehicle". Requested by the Department of Motor Vehicles.

885.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
885.title: An Act Concerning The Licensing Of Drivers' Schools And Driving Instructors.
885.description: To revise statutory provisions concerning drivers' schools and instructors. Requested by the Department of Motor Vehicles.

886.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
886.title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of A Certificate For The Operation Of A Taxicab And The Establishment Of A Penalty For The Operation Of A "gypsy" Cab.
886.description: To require the Department of Transportation to consider the effect of issuing a certificate for the operation of taxicabs upon existing certificate holders that operate in the territory in which the applicant for a certificate proposes to operate, and to establish a penalty for the operation of a gypsy cab.

887.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
887.title: An Act Concerning The Improvement Of Pedestrian Safety At Crosswalks Designated By Traffic Authorities.
887.description: To improve the safety of persons using crosswalks.

888.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
888.title: An Act Concerning The Upgrade Or Elimination Of Hazardous Railroad Crossings At Grade.
888.description: To implement a program for the upgrade or elimination of hazardous railroad crossings at grade.

889.title: An Act Authorizing Municipalities To Conduct A Pilot Program For The Use Of Automated Traffic Control Signal Enforcement Devices At Certain Intersections.
889.description: To authorize municipalities to conduct a pilot program for the use of automated traffic control signal enforcement devices at certain intersections.

890.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
890.title: An Act Concerning The Safety, Licensing, Inspection And Enforcement Responsibilities Of The Department Of Motor Vehicles.
890.description: To deter speeding on state highways by authorizing the installation and use of automated speed enforcement devices.

891.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Transportation
891.title: An Act Concerning Contractual Bidding Preferences For Veteran-owned Businesses.
891.description: To establish a set-aside program for veteran-owned small businesses.

892.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
892.title: An Act Concerning The Low-income Energy Advisory Board.
892.description: To make the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management, the Commissioner of Social Services and the chairperson of the Department of Public Utility Control ex-officio members of the Low- Income Advisory Board and to have board members elect a chairperson and vice-chairperson annually.

893.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
893.title: An Act Concerning Energy Efficiency Investments In Underserved Communities.
893.description: To dedicate funds for energy efficiency and load management projects in underserved communities.

894.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
894.title: An Act Concerning Satellite Television.
894.description: To provide greater access to the Connecticut Television Network.

895.title: An Act Concerning Telecommunications Companies' Audits And Filings.
895.description: To clarify for telecommunications companies when a document is considered filed with the Department of Public Utility Control and eliminate the need for a paper version of a filing sent electronically and when audits are required.

896.last_action: Removed from the Foot of the Calendar, Senate
896.title: An Act Concerning Telecommunications Providers' Subscriber Lists.
896.description: To allow individuals, who want their information listed, to be included in the telephone directory when their telephone provider is not already sharing the information.

897.title: An Act Adopting A Foster Parent Bill Of Rights.
897.description: To adopt a foster parent bill of rights.

898.title: An Act Concerning Biomedical Research Trust Fund Research Grants.
898.description: To allow grants made from the Biomedical Research Trust Fund to be used to fund research for Alzheimer's disease and diabetes.

899.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
899.title: An Act Concerning Capital Improvements Required By The Department Of Developmental Services.
899.description: To exempt capital improvements required by the Department of Developmental Services to certain facilities from the current rate freeze.

900.title: An Act Concerning Monthly Reports On Personnel Status For State Agencies.
900.description: To provide the Office of Fiscal Analysis with state agency personnel data, including the positions that are vacated and filled each month.

901.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
901.title: An Act Concerning Reductions To State Contracts.
901.description: To allow private providers to adjust their budgets to compensate for contract reductions made by state agencies without the prior approval of the agencies.

902.title: An Act Concerning Results-based Accountability.
902.description: To require budgeted agencies to designate a results-based accountability liaison to the General Assembly.

903.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
903.title: An Act Concerning Reporting By State Agencies.
903.description: To enhance the CORE-CT system as it relates to programmatic reporting and developing and monitoring state budgets, and to provide for additional financial reporting by certain agencies.

904.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
904.title: An Act Concerning Flexible Spending Accounts.
904.description: To allow the costs of state employee flexible spending account programs to be paid from program forfeitures and savings the state achieves in Social Security taxes.

905.title: An Act Concerning Implementation Of The S.a.f.e. Mortgage Licensing Act.
905.description: To further implement the S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act by addressing exempt registrant sponsorship and bonding of mortgage loan originators, establishing required surety bond amounts and making various other technical changes.

906.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
906.title: An Act Streamlining State Grant Distribution.
906.description: To require the Office of Policy and Management to review state grant programs to determine methods for streamlining grant processes and require the applicable agency to implement such methods.

907.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
907.title: An Act Concerning Polling Places For Primaries.
907.description: To permit municipalities to have fewer polling places for primary elections.

908.title: An Act Concerning Post-election Audits.
908.description: To streamline the post-election audit process.

909.title: An Act Concerning The Posting Of Public Agency Minutes And Legal Notices On The Internet Web Site Of A Municipality.
909.description: To extend the deadline by which all public agencies are required to post meeting minutes on their available web sites from seven to fourteen days, and to provide that noncompliance with this requirement by municipal agencies is not deemed a violation of the Freedom of Information Act under certain circumstances and to permit municipalities in compliance with this requirement to post legal notices on their web sites.

910.title: An Act Concerning Participation By The Staff And Members Of The Citizen's Ethics Advisory Board In Political Campaigns.
910.description: To prohibit the staff and members of the Citizen's Ethics Advisory Board and the Office of State Ethics from participating in political campaigns.

911.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
911.title: An Act Concerning The Right Of A Complainant To Intervene In A Housing Discrimination Action.
911.description: To confirm the decision in Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities v. Litchfield Housing Authority, et al., 117 CA 30 (2009), and clarify that an individual who files a complaint with the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities alleging housing discrimination may intervene in a civil action brought on the individual's complaint.

912.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of Paternity And Support And Enforcement Of Orders In Title Iv-d Child Support Cases.
912.description: To revise procedures for the establishment, modification and enforcement of child support orders in Title IV-D child support cases, and make technical changes to update, clarify and improve the consistency of child support statutes.

913.title: An Act Concerning The Enforcement Of Surety Contracts By Nursing Homes.
913.description: To prohibit nursing homes from enforcing surety contracts against a guarantor who fails to return a properly completed application for Title XIX benefits to the Department of Social Services.

914.title: An Act Concerning Medicaid Long-term Care Coverage For Married Couples.
914.description: To require the Commissioner of Social Services to amend the Medicaid state plan so that the community spouse of an institutionalized individual receives the maximum protected amount, as determined by federal law, and the proceeds of a reverse mortgage loan is not treated as income for the purpose of qualifying for Medicaid benefits.

915.title: An Act Concerning Service Requirements For Probate Judges.
915.description: To require probate judges to work at least forty hours per week, on average, to qualify for health insurance benefits.

916.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
916.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of Appropriated Funds Other Than The General Fund.
916.description: To review appropriations from appropriated funds other than the General Fund.

917.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
917.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The Department Of Correction.
917.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by the Department of Correction.

918.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
918.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The Judicial Department, The Division Of Criminal Justice, The Public Defender Services Commission And The State Marshal Commission.
918.description: To review expenditures of the Judicial Department, the Division of Criminal Justice, the Public Defender Services Commission and the State Marshal Commission.

919.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
919.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of State Agencies Providing Public Health, Mental Health And Developmental Services.
919.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by state agencies providing public health, mental health or developmental services.

920.title: An Act Concerning State Grant Commitments For School Building Projects, Municipal Accounts For Surplus Education Funds And Revisions To Certain Library Statutes.
920.description: To authorize state grant commitments for school building projects.

921.title: An Act Concerning School Construction Projects.
921.description: To require that all applications for school building projects contain a life-cycle cost analysis.

922.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
922.title: An Act Concerning The Teacher Education And Mentoring Program.
922.description: To provide a renewal fee waiver to those teachers holding an initial educator certificate, but who cannot apply for a provisional educator certificate because they have not completed the requisite beginning educator program; to provide a fee adjustment to those teachers who already renewed their initial educator certificate because they could not apply for a provisional educator certificate because they have not completed the requisite beginning educator program; and to include health teachers as among the list of teachers who shall complete the teacher education and mentoring program in full.

923.title: An Act Concerning Vocational-technical Schools.
923.description: To require the State Board of Education to conduct a formal vote before closing or suspending operations of a vocational-technical school; to require that at least two members of the State Board of Education have industrial, trade or technical school experience; to eliminate the state-wide advisory committee on regional vocational-technical schools and require an annual informational hearing regarding the vocational-technical school system; to require the State Bond Commission to vote on whether to issue bonds that the General Assembly approved for maintenance and trade and capital equipment for vocational-technical schools, but the commission has not allocated; to require the State Board of Education to inspect the busses in operation at the vocational-technical schools and to replace any school bus in service at a vocational-technical school that is ten years or older and to require the superintendent of the vocational-technical school system to report annually on such school bus replacement; to require that the vocational-technical school system be a separate line item in the budget; to require the superintendent of the vocational-technical school system to biannually submit the operating budgets for each individual vocational-technical school to OPM, OFA and the General Assembly and to make available such budgets on the vocational-technical school system's web site to allow the superintendent of the vocational-technical school system to purchase certain supplies and equipment independent of the Department of Administrative Services.

924.title: An Act Concerning Early Childhood Education Credentialing For School Readiness Programs For 2015.
924.description: To direct the Commissioner of Education to use unexpended funds for providing professional development to school readiness staff.

925.title: An Act Concerning Students With Terminally Ill Parents.
925.description: To require local and regional school boards to provide two hours of home instruction to students who are assisting with the care of a terminally ill parent.

926.title: An Act Requiring Biodiesel Blended Heating Oil And Lowering The Sulfur Content Of Heating Oil Sold In The State.
926.description: To amend the maximum sulfur content of home heating oil and establish a biodiesel blending requirement for such oil.

927.title: An Act Concerning A State-wide Water Use Plan.
927.description: To develop a state-wide water use plan.

928.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
928.title: An Act Concerning Reimbursement To Municipalities For The Cost Of Responding To Emergencies In State Parks.
928.description: To reimburse municipalities for responding to emergencies in state parks.

929.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Energy and Technology
929.title: An Act Creating Incentives For The Development Of Solar Energy.
929.description: To encourage the development of solar power and other renewable energy sources.

930.title: An Act Concerning The Adoption Of Regulations Relating To Water Use, Planning And Protection.
930.description: To create a more informed and coordinated approach among relevant state agencies prior to the adoption of regulations relating to the use, planning or protection of water.

931.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
931.title: An Act Concerning Solid And Hazardous Waste At Junkyards.
931.description: To examine the adequacy of the regulation of junkyards and motor vehicle recycler's yards in the state.

932.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
932.title: An Act Concerning Connecticut's Economic And Environmental Future.
932.description: To encourage job growth in sectors of the state economy that also help to preserve the environment.

933.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
933.title: An Act Concerning The Citizens' Election Program For State-wide Offices.
933.description: To make technical revisions to the elections related statutes which reflect the use of new voting technology.

934.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
934.title: An Act Concerning Cooperative Purchasing Plans.
934.description: To allow the state to use existing cooperative purchasing contracts to purchase certain goods and services.

935.title: An Act Concerning Child Care Subsidies Under The Care 4 Kids Program.
935.description: To require the Commissioner of Social Services to process all properly completed applications under the Care 4 Kids program within thirty days.

936.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
936.title: An Act Adjusting The Minimum Professional Liability Insurance Carried By Health Care Providers.
936.description: To require health insurance coverage for acupuncture treatments provided by a chiropractor and to increase the minimum amount of professional liability insurance a person licensed to practice chiropractic is required to carry.

937.title: An Act Concerning Standards In Health Care Provider Contracts.
937.description: To establish certain standards for contracts between health care providers and insurers.

938.title: An Act Concerning The Inspection Of Land For Use As An Ash Residue Facility By Certain State Quasi-public Agencies.
938.description: To reconstitute the board of directors of the Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority.

940.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
940.title: An Act Triggering Certain Economic Development Programs.
940.description: To grant the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development the authority to designate an additional enterprise zone.

941.title: An Act Concerning Puppy Mills And The Origin Of Other Potentially Sick Dogs Imported Into This State.
941.description: To require an assessment of the adequacy of certain provisions of the general statutes to effectively limit the importation of sick dogs into this state.

942.title: An Act Concerning Technical Revisions To The Citizens' Election Program.
942.description: To make technical revisions to the Citizens' Election Program.

943.title: An Act Establishing A Civil Action With Respect To Criminal Records Used In Employment Decisions.
943.description: To permit a civil action against a consumer reporting agency or an employer, employer's agent, representative or designee for a violation of statutory requirements concerning the request for, use of and reporting of criminal records with respect to employment decisions.

944.title: An Act Concerning Insurance Reimbursement Payments To School-based Health Centers.
944.description: To require that individual and group health insurance policies provide coverage for services received at a school-based health center to the extent that such services are a covered benefit under the policy.

945.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
945.title: An Act Concerning An Initiative To Increase And Improve The State's Health Care Workforce.
945.description: To develop an academic initiative that addresses the critical shortage of health care professionals in the state.

946.title: An Act Concerning The Behavioral Health Partnership.
946.description: To (1) include the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services in the Behavioral Health Partnership, (2) transfer primary responsibility for the setting of behavioral health provider service rates from the Departments of Children and Families, Social Services, and Mental Health and Addiction Services to the Behavioral Health Partnership Oversight Council, (3) allow the Behavioral Health Partnership to expand coverage to include SAGA medical services recipients, Medicaid recipients and Charter Oak Health Plan members, and (4) enable the Behavioral Health Partnership Oversight Council to review behavioral health services available under the Charter Oak Health Plan.

947.title: An Act Concerning Health Information Technology.
947.description: To replace the health information technology and exchange advisory committee that currently advises the Department of Public Health regarding implementation of the health information technology plan with a new Connecticut e-Health Institute. The institute would serve as the lead information exchange organization for the state, seek federal and private money for the development of a state-wide health information exchange and facilitate the implementation of the health information technology plan.

948.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of A Task Force To Review The Oversight Role Of Professional Examining Boards Regulating Health Care Professions.
948.description: To establish a task force that shall examine the current level of oversight provided by professional examining boards regulating the state's health care professions.

949.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
949.title: An Act Concerning The Development Of Cost Effective Supportive Housing For Frequent Users Of Costly State Services.
949.description: To increase the availability of supportive housing for homeless individuals and families who are frequent users of costly state services.

950.title: An Act Concerning The Motor Vehicle Operator's Retraining Program.
950.description: To allow qualified drivers' schools to offer the motor vehicle operator's retraining program.

951.title: An Act Requiring Motorcycle Training Prior To The Issuance Of A Motorcycle Endorsement.
951.description: To require the Department of Motor Vehicles to issue motor vehicle certificates of title electronically to enable lenders to secure liens in a timely fashion.

952.title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of Bradley International Airport.
952.description: To create an airport development zone comprised of census tract blocks in Windsor Locks, Suffield, East Granby and Windsor.

953.title: An Act Establishing A Pilot Program Using Civilian Volunteers To Assist In The Enforcement Of State And Municipal Laws Concerning Parking For Persons With Disabilities That Limit Or Impair The Ability To Walk And Persons With Blindness.
953.description: To establish a pilot program using civilian volunteers to assist in the enforcement of state and municipal laws concerning parking for persons with disabilities that limit or impair the ability to walk and persons with blindness.

954.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
954.title: An Act Concerning Persons Who Transport Patients Or Clients Under The Care, Control Or Custody Of A State Agency.
954.description: To establish standards for persons who transport patients or clients under the care, custody or control of a state agency, and to require a pilot program to examine interagency cost sharing of license checks.

955.title: An Act Concerning The Replacement Of The Broad Street Bridge Over The Amtrak Railroad Tracks In Hartford.
955.description: To authorize the Department of Transportation to replace the Broad Street Highway Bridge over the AMTRAK railroad tracks in Hartford. Requested by the Department of Transportation.

956.title: An Act Concerning The Environmental Impact Evaluation Prepared For A State-owned Airport Development Project, And The Requirements For The Preparation, Evaluation And Review Of Environmental Impact Evaluations.
956.description: To authorize, on or after January 1, 2009, the preparation of certain environmental impact evaluations, for an airport development project, by an independent contractor retained by a third party financing such development project.

957.title: An Act Concerning The Denial Of Prequalification Certificates By The Commissioner Of Administrative Services.
957.description: To establish criteria for the denial of prequalification certificates by the Commissioner of Administrative Services.

958.title: An Act Making Revisions To Statutes Concerning The Department Of Motor Vehicles.
958.description: To revise statutes concerning motor vehicle licenses, fees, emissions, penalties, and parking for persons with disabilities and persons who are blind. Requested by the Department of Motor Vehicles.

959.title: An Act Revising The Membership Of The Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority Board And The Environmental Justice Statute.
959.description: To revise the make up of the CRRA board and to expand the agencies covered by the environmental justice community statute, alter newspaper notice requirements under the statute and require negotiation of a community environmental benefit agreement.

960.title: An Act Concerning Energy From Combined Heat And Power Systems.
960.description: To allow electric company and electric distribution company customers, who employ combined heat and power systems, to benefit from net metering programs.

961.title: An Act Concerning Call Centers And The Timely Repair Of Public Utility Poles.
961.description: To encourage telecommunications companies to employ in-state call centers by allowing customers the option to be directed to an in-state call center and by encouraging the state when procuring services to give preference to telecommunications companies with in-state call centers, and to establish procedures for the timely repair of public utility poles.

962.title: An Act Concerning Audit Of The State's Telecommunications Expenses And Certain Filings With The Department Of Public Utility Control.
962.description: To require an audit of the state's telecommunications expenses.

963.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
963.title: An Act Requiring Documentation Of Utility Road Cuts.
963.description: To provide notice to municipal public works departments when public service companies make road cuts and repairs and to give such municipalities an opportunity to inspect a photograph of the repairs.

964.title: An Act Concerning The Broadcast Of Local Police Dispatch Calls.
964.description: To require local police departments to transmit their routine calls over unencrypted radio channels.

965.title: An Act Concerning Elections.
965.description: To amend various elections statutes and to provide that Woodbrige shall hold municipal elections in November, rather than May.

966.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Administrative Services' Pilot Program.
966.description: To extend the term of a pilot program for janitorial work for disadvantaged or disabled persons from four years to seven years.

967.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
967.title: An Act Concerning Recommendations Of The Connecticut Town Clerks Concerning Election Laws.
967.description: To exempt certain town records from address confidentiality provisions and to make certain changes to the election laws which affect town clerks and conform to current practice.

968.last_action: Senate Recommitted to Government Administration and Elections
968.title: An Act Concerning Agency Consolidation And The Creation Of The Health And Human Services Consolidation Steering Committee And The Extension Of A Pilot Program.
968.description: To establish a steering committee to make recommendations for legislative action for the gradual merging of the Departments of Public Health, Developmental Services, Children and Families, Mental Health and Addiction Services and Social Services into the Department of Human Services, and to extend the term of the pilot program for janitorial work for disadvantaged or disabled persons from four years to seven years.

969.title: An Act Concerning Nonpartisan Membership On Boards Of Education.
969.description: To provide that a member of a municipal board shall not have his or her term of office terminated because of an ordinance changing the number of members serving on such board and to authorize towns to provide for nonpartisan boards of education.

970.title: An Act Concerning Probate Districts.
970.description: To adopt the Connecticut Uniform Adult Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act.

972.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To Public Health Related Statutes And The Establishment Of The Health Information Technology Exchange Of Connecticut.
972.description: To make various revisions to public health related statutes.

973.title: An Act Concerning Most-favored-nation Clauses In Health Care Contracts.
973.description: To prohibit the use of most-favored-nation clauses in contracts between insurers and medical providers or hospitals.

974.last_action: Disagreeing Action, Tabled for Calendar, Senate
974.title: An Act Concerning Certain Cigarette Tax Violations.
974.description: To provide that certain violations of the cigarette dealer licensing laws are infractions, rather than misdemeanors.

975.title: An Act Concerning Collateral For Securities Lending By The State Treasurer.
975.description: To expand the category of collateral that may serve as consideration for the lending of securities from combined investment funds established by the Treasurer.

976.title: An Act Concerning A Review Of Tax Credits.
976.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning the review, repeal and modification of certain tax credits.

977.title: An Act Concerning The Burden Of Proof In Tax Appeals.
977.description: To establish the burden of proof in tax appeals.

979.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
979.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Fee Increases.
979.description: To provide for increases in certain municipal fees.

980.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Revenue.
980.description: To increase sources of municipal revenue by giving municipalities local option taxing authority and allowing them to unilaterally increase fees otherwise set or limited by statute.

981.title: An Act Concerning The Tobacco Products Tax.
981.description: To impose a tax on noncigarette smoking tobacco that is equal to the tax on cigarettes.

982.title: An Act Concerning Education Reform In Connecticut.
982.description: To remove fiscal restrictions that limit the State Board of Education's ability to grant charters to local and state charter schools; to eliminate the enrollment cap of eighty-five students per grade for state charter schools that have demonstrated a record of achievement; to extend the Commissioner of Education's authority to provide grants to state charter schools for capital expenses; and to increase the per pupil grant to districts receiving open choice program students.

983.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
983.title: An Act Concerning The Study Of Educational Stability For Children In Foster Care.
983.description: To require a study of issues involving educational stability for children in foster care in Connecticut.

984.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
984.title: An Act Concerning School Districts And Teacher Performance Evaluation Programs.
984.description: To expand the state-wide public school information system to collect and analyze measures of student growth for purposes of monitoring teacher effectiveness.

985.title: An Act Concerning Parental Engagement In Schools.
985.description: To require a study of issues involving education in Connecticut.

986.title: An Act Concerning Boards Of Education.
986.description: To amend the accountability statute to allow the Commissioner of Education to reconstitute local or regional boards of education for school districts designated and listed as a low achieving school district.

987.title: An Act Concerning The Cancellation Of Unissued Bond Fund Authorizations.
987.description: To cancel unissued authorizations in inactive bond funds, thereby allowing the state bond commission to approve release of the funds to the general fund.

988.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Nonresident Contractor Bond Statute.
988.description: To make changes to the existing statute governing nonresident contractor bonds for payment of all applicable taxes in order to streamline the process and provide quicker resolution for the contractors involved.

989.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
989.title: An Act Enhancing The Ability Of The Department Of Revenue Services To Collect Outstanding Taxes.
989.description: To make certain changes increasing the ability of the Department of Revenue Services to collect outstanding taxes, including allowing the department, by regulation, to require license applicants to obtain a tax clearance from the department before being allowed to obtain a license, allowing the department to recoup its collections costs and attorney's fees when it is the prevailing party in a civil action brought in the courts of another state, and creating a "responsible person" concept for the trust taxes, i.e. sales and use tax, admissions and dues tax, motor vehicle fuels tax and employer withholding tax.

990.title: An Act Concerning Child Support Orders, Enforcement And Reports.
990.description: To (1) revise provisions concerning child support enforcement and orders, (2) permit the Department of Social Services to share information with the Department of Correction and the Judicial Branch to identify inmates, parolees and probationers with IV-D support cases who may benefit from programming that will increase the inmate's parolee's or probationer's ability to fulfill the duty to support, (3) require a court to determine paternity in certain cases concerning custody, care, education, visitation and support of any minor child of the parties if paternity has not been established, (4) allow IV-D agency reports to the General Assembly to be filed in electronic form, and (5) make conforming changes among various sections and make technical changes.

991.title: An Act Concerning The Appointment Of A Guardian Ad Litem For An Adult Who Is Subject To A Conservatorship Or A Conservatorship Proceeding.
991.description: To provide that a person who is subject to a proceeding to appoint a conservator or who has been appointed a conservator shall not be appointed a guardian ad litem in a probate, family or other proceeding, except for the limited purpose of determining the person's preferences.

992.title: An Act Concerning Applications For Relief From Physical Abuse By A Family Or Household Member.
992.description: To: (1) Require that an application to the Superior Court for relief from physical abuse by a family or household member include an affidavit that alleges a continuous threat of present physical pain or physical injury consistent with the requirements for relief under the statute, and (2) make technical changes.

993.title: An Act Concerning Annual Review Of Child Support Orders, A Study Of Child Support Enforcement Mechanisms, And Continuation Of Child Support Obligations After Parental Rights Are Terminated Due To Sexual Abuse.
993.description: To: (1) Permit a court to order that a parent's child support obligation continue, upon motion of the other parent, if the obligor's parental rights were terminated due to sexual abuse and conviction of a crime therefore, (2) require the court or family support magistrate that enters a support order to annually schedule a hearing on the order, and (3) establish a task force to study child support enforcement mechanisms used in other states.

994.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
994.title: An Act Establishing A Revolving Loan Fund For Small Businesses.
994.description: To preserve jobs and encourage job creation in Connecticut.

995.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
995.title: An Act Concerning Investment In Community Banks.
995.description: To increase the pool of funds available to the Treasurer for investment in community banks.

996.title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Economic And Community Development To Establish Metrics To Measure The Outreach Efforts Of The State's Economic Development Entities.
996.description: To establish metrics to monitor the state's economic development agencies' efforts to serve people and businesses of the state.

997.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
997.title: An Act Concerning The State's Regulatory Environment.
997.description: To direct the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee to examine the state's regulatory environment.

998.title: An Act Concerning The Internal Organization Of The Department Of Economic And Community Development.
998.description: To require the Department of Economic and Community Development to take a team-based approach to cluster-based initiatives.

999.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Sports And Marketing Corporation.
999.description: To establish a nonprofit corporation for the purpose of attracting, retaining, and promoting sporting events and activities in the state.

1000.title: An Act Concerning Student Athletes And Concussions.
1000.description: To require coaches of intramural and interscholastic athletics to complete annual training regarding the recognition of and dangers associated with concussions; and to require that student athletes get medical clearance before returning to athletic activity after sustaining a concussion or head injury.

1001.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1001.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Correction.
1001.description: To increase the penalty for assaulting an employee of the department with certain substances and fluids, require the department be notified when a request is made to a public agency for disclosure of information about a correctional facility, prohibit the possession of an electronic wireless communication device by an inmate, revise provisions concerning inmate discharge savings accounts, require the readmission of students who return to school after being in the custody of the department, allow the disclosure of information concerning a youth in the custody of the department to the youth's parents or guardian and allow an inmate to remain in a correctional facility beyond the inmate's discharge date.

1002.title: An Act Concerning Restoration Of Eligibility To Possess Firearms Under Federal Law.
1002.description: To provide a process for a person prohibited from possessing or receiving firearms under federal law on account of such person's mental or developmental disabilities to be granted relief from that prohibition.

1003.title: An Act Concerning The Enhanced Penalty For The Sale Or Possession Of Drugs Near Schools, Day Care Centers And Public Housing Projects.
1003.description: To revise the circumstances when an enhanced penalty is imposed for the sale or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia near schools, day care centers and public housing projects and allow judges more discretion in sentencing persons convicted of those crimes.

1004.title: An Act Concerning Low-income Energy Rates.
1004.description: To establish a low-income discount rate for gas and electric customers.

1005.title: An Act Concerning Siting Council Proceedings And Decisions.
1005.description: To add to the considerations the siting council must make before issuing a certificate of public need.

1006.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1006.title: An Act Concerning Power Plant Safety.
1006.description: To strengthen safety measures at power plants that utilize natural gas.

1007.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1007.title: An Act Concerning Financing Of Energy Efficiency And Renewable Energy.
1007.description: To establish an energy savings infrastructure loan program by securitizing certain moneys and leveraging private investments, as well as to commit to a goal of fifty per cent of RPS to be Connecticut-based investments by 2020; to commit to building an energy-based economy; to commit to supporting Connecticut-based technologies; to allow for a financing term equal to the useful life of a technology; to enable financing of technology to be tied to meter rather than property owner; to reduce dependence on foreign fuel and to reduce carbon emissions.

1008.title: An Act Concerning Energy And Technology Research And Development.
1008.description: To require the Department of Public Utility Control to consult with the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority with regard to its programs and establishing such an entity in this state.

1009.title: An Act Concerning The Regulation Of Underground Propane Storage Tank Companies.
1009.description: To provide tenants a choice when purchasing propane.

1010.title: An Act Concerning Federal Funds.
1010.description: To make technical corrections to the statute concerning agency applications for federal funds.

1011.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1011.title: An Act Establishing The Lean Government Steering Committee.
1011.description: To require state agencies to implement lean techniques to improve current processes.

1012.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1012.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Public Works And A Report Of Unexpended Bond Proceeds.
1012.description: To make technical changes and to require the report submitted to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to finance, revenue and bonding to be submitted in accordance with section 11-4a of the general statutes.

1013.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1013.title: An Act Concerning The Commission On Enhancing Agency Outcomes.
1013.description: To require the Commission on Enhancing Outcomes to submit an additional report on its findings.

1014.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Economic And Community Development And Eligible Business Facilities.
1014.description: To make technical changes to the statute concerning community development projects.

1015.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Information Technology.
1015.description: To require the report submitted by the Department of Information Technology to be submitted in accordance with the provisions of section 11-4a of the general statutes.

1016.title: An Act Concerning State Agency Permissive In-state Contracting Preferences And A Pilot Program For Janitorial Employees.
1016.description: To allow state contractors to adjust their bid to deduct the amount of state income taxes that would be paid by those employed on the project, and to provide that if the aggregate amount actually paid to such employees is less than projected, the amount paid to the contractor would reflect such difference, and to extend the term of the pilot program for janitorial work for disadvantaged or disabled persons from four years to seven years.

1017.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Transportation
1017.title: An Act Concerning State Contracting, A Pilot Program And The Prequalification Of Contractors.
1017.description: To allow private service providers to adjust their budget expenditures without approval when a state agency reduces the providers' funding, to require the filing of state contracts with a potential duration of ten years or more with the General Assembly for approval, to extend the term of a pilot program for janitorial work for disadvantaged or disabled persons from four years to seven years and to establish additional criteria for the denial of prequalification certificates by the Commissioner of Administrative Services.

1018.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections
1018.title: An Act Defining Grass Roots Lobbying.
1018.description: To define "grass roots lobbying" and clarify the exemptions to the term "expenditure".

1019.title: An Act Concerning Nonviolent Offenders.
1019.description: To require court and correctional personnel to assess persons arrested or convicted of nonviolent crimes and consider recommending that such persons be released to home confinement with GPS monitoring in lieu of incarceration.

1020.title: An Act Concerning Nonviolent Drug Possession Offenses.
1020.description: To reduce costs to the state by reclassifying the use or possession of drug paraphernalia and the possession of a small amount of a cannabis-type substance as infractions rather than misdemeanors.

1021.title: An Act Concerning A Tax Credit For Making Jobs Accessible To Employees With Autism Spectrum Disorders.
1021.description: To provide a tax credit to employers to defray the cost of a job coach for employees with autism spectrum disorders.

1022.title: An Act Concerning Changes To The Estate And Gift Tax, The Hospital Tax And The Attorneys' Occupational Tax.
1022.description: To clarify and strengthen the existing law relating to intra-corporation transfers.

1023.title: An Act Concerning The Attendance Of Registered Sexual Offenders At School Functions Involving Their Children.
1023.description: To allow parents who are registered sexual offenders to attend events and meetings at their child's school that are of importance in their child's life or that concern their child's education notwithstanding any local ordinance that might otherwise bar them from school property.

1024.title: An Act Concerning Cooperative Health Care Arrangements.
1024.description: To permit health care providers to enter into cooperative arrangements that would not be subject to certain antitrust laws after approval by the Attorney General, and to require managed care organizations to negotiate in good faith with providers who participate in such arrangements.

1025.title: An Act Concerning Seat Safety Belt Evidence And Medical Examinations In Personal Injury Actions.
1025.description: To: (1) Permit the introduction of evidence of whether an occupant was wearing a seat safety belt at the time of personal injury in an action to recovery damages for the purpose of determining the cause of injury or as a mitigating circumstance, and (2) require a plaintiff to comply with a request for an independent medical examination in a personal injury action, except upon a showing of good cause by the plaintiff.

1026.title: An Act Concerning Collateral Source Benefits In Civil Actions.
1026.description: To clarify the definition of collateral sources in personal injury and wrongful death actions.

1027.title: An Act Concerning The Posting Of A Bond By The State In Prejudgment Remedy Applications And Appeals.
1027.description: To provide that the state or any public officer shall not be required to post a bond when applying for a prejudgment remedy or appealing from a court order concerning a prejudgment remedy.

1028.title: An Act Concerning Securitization.
1028.description: To effectuate a securitization of existing charges on electric bills through the issuance of rate replacement bonds, of proceeds from instituting the game of keno, or of tobacco settlement funds, and to impose a hospital user fee.

1029.title: An Act Concerning Tax Fairness.
1029.description: To enhance the equity and effectiveness of the corporation business tax by instituting a combined unitary tax.

1030.title: An Act Concerning Supreme Court And Appellate Court Decisions.
1030.description: To require the Supreme Court and Appellate Court to render a decision in a case not later than one year after hearing oral argument.

1031.title: An Act Concerning The Unauthorized Practice Of Law.
1031.description: To define "the practice of law" in conformity with Section 2-44A of the Connecticut Practice Book, and revise penalties for the unauthorized practice of law.

1032.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1032.title: An Act Concerning Letters Of Protection.
1032.description: To require physicians and physical therapists to inform a patient whether they would provide care and treatment to such patient in return for a letter of protection guaranteeing payment from any settlement or judgment that may be received by the patient.

1033.title: An Act Concerning Uninsured And Underinsured Motorist Coverage For Bodily Injury To A Named Insured Or Relative.
1033.description: To require uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage for a motor vehicle or motorcycle owned by a named insured that is otherwise insured but is used without the authorization of the named insured and strikes the named insured or a household member as a pedestrian.

1034.title: An Act Concerning The Liability Of Servers Of Alcohol.
1034.description: To encourage liquor permit holders to install breath alcohol testing devices and train their employees in responsible alcohol service and to revise liability and notice provisions under the dram shop act.

1035.title: An Act Concerning Liens On Real Property Related To Taxes, Assessments And Charges.
1035.description: To require towns, fire, sewer and other districts and other entities that provide water, sewerage and other services to provide a lien certificate that establishes the amount due as of the date of the certificate for the purpose of filing on the land records and discharging amounts not included in the certificate.

1036.title: An Act Concerning Deficit Mitigation For The Biennium Ending June 30, 2011.
1036.description: An Act Concerning Deficit Mitigation For The Biennium Ending June 30, 2011.

1037.title: An Act Reducing Electricity Costs And Promoting Renewable Energy.
1037.description: An Act Reducing Electricity Costs And Promoting Renewable Energy.
